In the face of the chaos and confusion that come with raising family today parents across America turn to very specific place for sanctuary and relief
While it may not be fancy or private it got an air of sophistication and serenity
What is this magical place
Well
Target apparently
It no secret that parents particularly moms love to love Target
They write rhapsodizing blog posts create fan Instagram accounts draw comics and tweet endlessly about their Target obsessions
At least one mom chose to take her maternity photos at Target store and another even gave birth to her child in one albeit unintentionally
But what exactly is it that makes Target so appealing to moms and dads
We spoke to marketing experts therapists and parents themselves to find out
never thought dashing to Target without kids would feel like mini vacation but it does
And sometimes that all mom of little kids needs to recharge mom and blogger Jennifer White told HuffPost

Indeed many parents find that Target offers them an opportunity to escape the chaos and stress at home without feeling guilty because after all they re running errands and buying necessities and some non necessities too for their families

Target is close by and more socially acceptable place for parents to sneak away to solo than say bar said mom and blogger Samantha Taylor who also told HuffPost she sees solo Target trips as mini vacations
Jennifer Cutler an assistant professor of marketing at Northwestern University Kellogg School of Management
believes Target offers sense of whimsical escapism that particularly appeals to parents
Part of its brand is trying to make the shopping experience treat
One thing that parents have in common is shortage of time
Being able to reframe the drudgery of running errands as whimsical escapism is really powerful she told HuffPost pointing out the colorful and even magical imagery in the brand marketing materials
It saying Come to this magical place where you can get whatever your heart desires clean friendly place with Starbucks coffee and popcorn waiting for you Cutler added
think that really resonates because it joins productive activity with something whimsical and almost vacation like in the experience
The convenience and affordability of big box store are undeniable as well
Target is so addictive because it has everything you need from batteries to groceries to cat litter
And it has bunch of stuff you don need but really want when you see it like super cute earrings for you and cheap adorable outfit separates for your kids Taylor explained
We feel guilty about going on frivolous shopping binge but not about throwing pair of clearance earrings in with the cleaning supplies inside our cart
Still it goes beyond the convenience and low prices which many major stores offer
The physical experience of being in Target store is another reason parents give for their fandom
Walking into Target is mild high in itself said Taylor
That food court and smell of popcorn
That cute little dog
That comfortingly simple logo
That Dollar Spot where everything is actually but that OK
The blogger also also cited the presence of Starbucks in many Targets HELLO strolling the racks under the guise of shopping for necessities with steaming Caramel Macchiato

The neat appearance of the stores can also feel refreshing for parents as households with young kids are not necessarily so clean and organized said Mabel Yiu licensed marriage and family therapist and mother of twins
You walk into Target and the lighting the colors even the smell really capture you because it feels great said Yiu
It like it increases the dopamine in the brain
You see that everything is really well organized and even color coded
As mom my home doesn look like that
So you walk in and think This is really great
Dad and blogger Beau Coffron echoed this sentiment
They do great job of keeping the aisles organized so you don feel like you re in the middle of tornado with stuff everywhere like some stores are he told HuffPost
The look and feel of Target stores appeal to consumers different senses from the sound of upbeat music to the scent of coffee and popcorn

Rima Tour Tillery an assistant professor at the Kellogg School who studies the intersection of motivation and self perception in marketing said the inviting appearance of Target relates to the brand colors red and white
Research shows that people see red as fun fiery daring color and the color of love
Meanwhile white gives sense of cleanliness spaciousness and elegance
These associations are not things people consciously think about but they influence you said Tour Tillery
So just being exposed to the red and white in the store can give you an impression of sophistication
Maybe that explains why people say Tar jay to make the store sound fancier
Collaborations with high end brands like Proenza Schouler Missoni and Jason Wu also add to this classier image
Store layouts and color schemes are typically very conscious choices meant to appeal to consumers
Brands aren stupid

They re studying this and the retail environment they re trying to create is to maximize the experience the memories the emotion said the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania marketing professor Americus Reed noting that there are design principles meant to pique shoppers curiosity and guide them through the store
Store designs can also appeal to children shopping with their parents
Aisles are designed certain way
Things that are going to be important for kids are lower to the ground
That for reason Reed told HuffPost
In the case of Target parents can use the presence of toys and other fun things for kids to their advantage by using them as potential rewards for good behavior in the store
prefer to shop Target alone as sort of pathetic mini vacation but if bring my kids like to keep them strapped in to the baby seat whenever possible Taylor told HuffPost
Usually ll reward them with trip to the toy aisle just to look if they behave
Creating memorable appealing shopping experience is crucial in the age of online retail giants
Indeed recent reports have shown disappointing profits for Target as it competes with Amazon
Behemoths like Amazon are commoditizing convenience
People don want to go out and be physically in stores as much anymore because you can just hop online and get box in few hours Reed said
You have to create other experiences in shopping context that are going to make it worthwhile to go out and do that instead of going to Amazon com
So maybe that creating some more motivational impetus for these brands like Target to craft richer experience for parents and children going in the store
One way to combat the growing influence of Amazon happens to be another reason experts cited when exploring why parents are so obsessed with Target identity loyalty

The concept is that there are some brands for which the brand itself transcends the functional features the utilitarian benefits in terms of what it does and it becomes something that is part of who you are Reed explained
When the brand becomes part and parcel with some important aspect of your desired self expression then the brand identity and your own identity become fused
It like the brand is part of who you are and you have loyalty to it because it a symbol of what you aspire to express to other people
Kellogg marketing professor Angela Lee echoed that
Many young moms identify with Target with the image of fun and fashionable that the store projects
That what it means when one is committed loyalist
the brand becomes part of the self
When brands achieve identity loyalty they essentially have free marketing department
Loyal followers proselytize and also defend the brand against criticism because an attack on the brand feels in some way like an attack on the self
In some ways one identity as parent can become wrapped up in store like Target
At the end of shopping trip you have shopped for many aspects of your life
you got birthday gifts for kid party gifts for your in laws yoga pants for exercising work clothes etc
You walk out feeling very accomplished and competent Yiu explained
And your self image matches the idealized self you see in Target ads showing happy competent parents
White told HuffPost she noticed many kids love Target almost as much as their parents do
Once took my kids out for ice cream
It was surprise and expected them to be thrilled White recalled
They weren
They looked out the window across the street to Target and said they wanted to go there for their surprise instead
In this way the store creates opportunities for parenting wins ways to live up to an idealized image of perfect parent

This conservative Christian approach to gender relations is known as complementarianism
In recent podcast Piper argued that society departure from these traditional roles over the past years has laid the groundwork for sexual abuse

In fact he scheduled to speak alongside some of the country top evangelical leaders at conference for pastors in Louisville Kentucky next month
At the same time Piper claims have elicited strong criticism from some fellow Christians
Advocates for survivors of sexual abuse and their allies don believe Piper suggestion will bring about positive change
Indeed they re worried this traditional way of thinking about women roles is part of the problem
These advocates say Piper needs to do more to acknowledge the ways complementarian theology has been abused especially in evangelical settings
Christa Brown clergy sex abuse survivor who blogs about abuse cover ups in church settings told HuffPost that Piper is endorsing gender dynamic that can easily lead to exploitation and mistreatment
Many of the survivors she worked with have told her they were groomed for abuse by patriarchal theology that taught them to be submissive and obedient toward men

Piper remarks were from an episode of his Ask Pastor John podcast in which he fielded question about the sexual abuse allegations that have emerged against several high profile men as result of the Me Too movement

Asked to share his thoughts on these abuse allegations Piper responded by bringing up an age old debate in Christian theology between two perspectives on gender relations complementarianism and egalitarianism
In the complementarian view men and women are equally treasured by God but have distinct divinely ordained roles
As spiritual heads of the household men have final authority over women in both spiritual and practical matters
They are expected to exercise this authority in self sacrificial way the way Christians believe Jesus gave his life for the church
Women meanwhile are expected to submit to their husbands at home at church and sometimes in society
According to egalitarianism however neither men nor women are automatically granted headship
They are seen as spiritual equals in the eyes of God and divide responsibilities based on their capabilities rather than by gender
In his podcast Piper claimed that egalitarianism is responsible for breakdown of the structures that previously kept women safe
As more people embrace the idea that men and women are equal he said men have stopped feeling the need to protect and honor women

Piper argued that modern ideas of gender equality are actually partly to blame for the alleged abusive behavior of people like film producer Harvey Weinstein comedian Louis K and former Senate candidate Roy Moore
It a firm conviction of most of our egalitarian culture that men as men do not owe women special kind of care and protection and honor that women do not owe men
I believe they do Piper said in the podcast
believe years of denying it is one of the seeds bearing very bad fruit including all those sexual abuses talked about in the listener question

but it only since the advent of feminism and the emergence of Christian egalitarianism that Western society has progressed to point where the abuse of women is understood to be unacceptable
Piper references the last years as the age of egalitarianism and posits that it is the reason we are seeing sexual abuse happen Hannah Paasch an ex Christian blogger told HuffPost in an email

We urge the administration not to impose tariffs and to work with the business community to find an effective but measured solution to China protectionist trade policies and practices that protects American jobs and competitiveness the groups wrote
Tariffs would be particularly harmful they said
The groups called on Trump to work with trade allies to push for changes to China policies

The business groups said while they had serious concerns about China approach to trade unilateral tariffs by the United States would only separate the country from allies and encourage them to replace the S business presence in China when Beijing retaliates
Trade associations publicly pushing back include the S Chamber of Commerce the National Retail Federation and the Information Technology Industry Council

The Trump administration is said to be preparing tariffs against Chinese information technology telecoms and consumer products in an attempt to force changes in Beijing intellectual property and investment practices
The Republican president recently announced plans to impose tariffs on certain steel and aluminum imports despite opposition from some business sectors
The groups also called on Trump to allow industry experts to comment on the economic impact of any changes in trade policy before the measures take effect

By Richard Tolman University of Michigan The Conversation Can President Donald Trump recent repudiation of domestic violence actually help prevent it
Rob Porter high level aide to Trump was accused of serial domestic violence by his two ex wives
The controversy dominated news coverage earlier this month
Trump publicly denounced domestic violence one week after Porter resigned saying m totally opposed to domestic violence of any kind
Those who called for such statement by the president may be motivated by the belief that when powerful men convincingly call out abusers society acceptance of domestic violence can be diminished
There is not lot of research to support this commonsense idea
But there is growing body of work with men and boys that research shows can be effective in diminishing domestic violence
This is significant evolution in the field

Since the establishment of the first domestic violence shelters in the domestic violence policies and services have rightly focused most attention on survivors and meeting their needs for safety and healing
Increasingly though domestic violence organizations are adopting approaches that involve men and boys in domestic violence prevention
The idea is that by addressing the root causes these programs can stop domestic violence from occurring in the first place
I am professor who studies how to intervene and prevent men violence against women
Our research team has researched the effectiveness of programs that involve boys and men in domestic violence prevention efforts
Much of the work being done with men and boys is not well known despite the fact that this is thriving movement
Here is snapshot of some of those efforts both global and local and what we know about their effectiveness
Some efforts to involve men are directed in the arena of sports because well men like sports
They venerate sports figures and identify with teams
Reports of domestic violence perpetrated by athletes have grown more common
This has led to visible efforts by sports organizations to respond with sanctions for perpetrators and to become part of prevention efforts like the NFL No More
The seriousness and effectiveness of these efforts are yet to be determined
But sports have also been the site of innovative and effective interventions for youth
Coaching Boys Into Men provides high school athletic coaches with the resources they need help prevent relationship abuse harassment and sexual assault by their players
The program curriculum includes coach to athlete trainings that model respect and promote healthy relationships
It also includes card series to help coaches incorporate themes of teamwork integrity fair play and respect into their daily practice and routine
Coaching Boys Into Men has been rigorously evaluated found to be effective in reducing dating violence and is being widely implemented in the S and replicated in other countries
A prime risk factor for future abuse is the exposure of children to violence
Preventing abuse in new families would reduce children exposure to violence and thus the potential for future violence
One promising strategy is to involve men in prevention efforts as they move into fatherhood
Research shows that caring and supportive relationship with their fathers reduces the risk of harsh physical discipline by the next generation of parents both for fathers and mothers
Positive fathering predicts warmer and more positive parenting by adult sons when they become fathers

Strategies that could be used in this area include engaging men at prenatal visits such as ultrasound appointments which the vast majority of men in the S attend and at in home visits during pregnancy and after the birth of child
Global campaigns such as MenCare seek to improve caregiving by fathers and address partner violence
MenCare programs ask men to become more equitable partners and provide them with opportunities to learn and practice parenting skills
They promote policy change like paid parental leave
And they conduct media campaigns to inspire men and their communities to support men caregiving
Studies document high levels of dating violence beginning in middle school

When it comes to prevention one could argue that programs must intervene early or the effort will be wasted because stopping abuse before it becomes entrenched pattern is more likely to be effective in preventing relationship violence
School based abuse prevention programs like Safe Dates and Fourth have shown some success in changing attitudes and behavior

The Safe Dates program for example uses nine minute sessions student performed minute play and poster contest to explore topics on how to cultivate caring relationships overcome gender stereotypes and help friends
Bystander prevention programs increasingly commonplace on college campuses build skills to recognize respond to and disrupt behavior that might lead to sexual assault or intimate partner violence

Some examples of bystander behavior include telling man who is saying disrespectful things about women to stop or helping woman who is being harassed to get away from situation in which she could be harmed
Teens involved in bystander interventions are more likely to intervene to prevent victimization of their peers
Our research group surveyed men around the world who have been involved in efforts to prevent violence against women
The survey revealed that many men who get involved have personal experience with violence as child witnesses or survivors of their own child abuse
Still others find their way to prevention efforts through commitment to social justice
Importantly we found that many men are receptive to violence prevention efforts when they tune in to survivors experiences

However much you tip your Uber driver it probably not enough
And however much Uber pays its drivers it almost definitely not enough either

Those are two big takeaways from new working paper by group of researchers led by Stephen Zoepf executive director of the Center for Automotive Research at Stanford University and researcher at the MIT Center for Energy and Environmental Policy Research which found that substantial percentage of drivers for ride hailing companies probably earn less than they think they do though their wages are padded thanks to per mile tax deductions
As working paper it important to note the figures haven been peer reviewed and are subject to change
Nevertheless it offers interesting insight into an industry where driver pay has been the subject of much scrutiny

Unlike previous economic analyses that report drivers gross profits without factoring in operational costs the MIT paper takes into account how much drivers spend on things like insurance maintenance repairs fuel and the car depreciation in value using data from Edmunds Kelley Blue Book and the Environmental Protection Agency

Once those costs are accounted for the working paper found percent of ride hailing drivers make less than the minimum wage in their states and percent of drivers actually lose money for every mile they drive
In the survey of drivers the median driver earned per mile and paid out per mile in vehicle costs leading to median hourly profit of
Notably choice few drivers with the most efficient vehicles and running the most profitable routes were able to turn out revenue of per mile
Zoepf told HuffPost the Toyota Prius gas electric hybrid was drivers vehicle of choice by factor of two
More than percent of the drivers surveyed said they work less than hours per week
It isn all bad news for drivers however
The paper found nearly half of all drivers can declare loss for tax purposes at the federal tax deduction rate of roughly per mile

Per the researchers that drastically decreases the amount of taxable income drivers need to report to the extent that an estimated percent of driver profit representing billions of dollars is going untaxed

At an average of month in net profit per driver and with hundreds of thousands of drivers in the S alone the standard mileage deduction facilitates billions of dollars of untaxed income and hundreds of millions of unrealized tax revenue the paper notes
This untaxed profit represents social subsidy for the ride hailing business model
Lyft didn respond to request for comment from HuffPost but spokesman for Uber vigorously disputed the paper methodology and findings
While the paper is certainly attention grabbing its methodology and findings are deeply flawed the spokesman said
We ve reached out to the paper authors to share our concerns and suggest ways we might work together to refine their approach
Zoepf didn immediately respond to followup questions about his methodology
Compared to other studies that used different methodology the MIT paper is indeed an outlier

A National Bureau of Economic Research study in November found drivers in six major metropolitan areas earned around an hour not taking into account hourly costs varying from to per hour depending on the hours they worked and the vehicle they drove

Campbell Reader Survey provided the hard data the researchers used for their paper
Using the same data Campbell came up with an average hourly rate of around an hour not taking drivers operational costs into account
But he said even if MIT methodology needs to be tweaked which is possible since it a working paper
its fundamental finding is spot on Drivers aren making enough money

The Millennial Shopper is the Mass Maximizer The consumer characteristic outsiders overlook about Millennials is that when it comes to spending we are generation of maximizers and it both blessing and curse

Over the past few months ve read several essays linking makeup and professionalism

Written by stylish women working in corporate America these articles insist that daily makeup application is must for working women and that going without it may degrade your image of competence and reliability
They inevitably cite recent study the results of which indicate that women wearing just the right amount of makeup appear more trustworthy and likable to most observers
And they send readers scrambling to Sephora to upgrade their stashes
never experimented with makeup as girl and didn even learn to pluck my eyebrows until was
The older get the more find myself relying on cosmetics to define and conceal shape and highlight my features
And although d rather spend my precious minutes reading or sleeping or kissing my husband don actively resent my ever expanding makeup application routine
I do however resent the implication that woman without makeup doesn belong in the workplace or that applying makeup is essential to career success
And here why Laws versus policing encourage my readers and clients to select clothing that fits their figures and broadcasts their confidence and self respect
I believe that dressing is social contract and that understanding the norms surrounding appropriate dressing choice for various life situations will ease human relationships
But am also aware that there are laws about clothing
Actual laws that apply to both men and women
To go about in public and not be fined or arrested humans must be clothed
And in my opinion since we ve got to get dressed anyway we might as well do it expressively and in ways that feel good
Since dressing is social we can also make style choices that will make us appear polished impressive and self aware
So in my view acquiring an understanding of how to dress is both beneficial and required
There are no laws about wearing makeup
Makeup is entirely optional everywhere
Although some men wear makeup the majority of makeup consumers and wearers are women

And to tell these women that they should feel obliged to apply makeup on daily basis in order to garner the respect and admiration of their colleagues is to police their behaviors based solely on social norms
To say that makeup is essential to workplace achievement is to promote the belief that the performance of traditional femininity is the only route to professional success for women

To insist on set of grooming related behaviors that doesn remove dirt or odor doesn make something that is naturally messy look neater and really only serves to enhance or amplify certain facial features is to remind women that their physical selves are never going to be acceptable in their natural state
I understand that there are plenty of voluntary behaviors that human beings engage to further their personal goals plenty of things we do because they re beneficial though not required

And yet this case is so focused on forcing women to be and look one specific way can help but feel it is more about reinforcing existing social norms than it is about ensuring the professional success of women as group
The fine line But what about that study you ask
Well first off it was funded by Procter Gamble company that manufactures and sells makeup and was undoubtedly thrilled to see results linking makeup and trustworthiness
But perhaps more importantly the results emphasized that while barefaced is too little glamorous is too much
If you apply just the right amount of eyeshadow and blush you appear more capable reliable and amiable
But overdo it and there may be lowering of trust
So not only are you being asked to spend money on cosmetics and spend your time and energy applying them you must be very careful not to apply too little or too much or you risk ruining everything
Without makeup you re unprofessional inexperienced hippie or child or socially oblivious loser
With too much makeup you re unprofessional in an entirely different way still socially oblivious but more on the sexualized diva end of the spectrum
There are parallels to dressing here of course Women are expected to dress in ways that aren too dowdy or too slutty
Fall too far on either side and you risk ridicule and censure by the lady policing machinery built into modern society
This is nothing you ll ever hear me defending
But again wearing clothing is required by law and since you ve got to get dressed anyway choosing to align your lawfully required garments with social expectations may work to your benefit
Makeup is optional
And if you aren naturally interested in it and you ARE going to be judged negatively should you fail to apply the exact right amount of it why bother at all

Focus on accomplishment give presentations on professional dress and grooming to college seniors and women leadership programs so you ll never hear me say that how you present your physical self in professional situations is irrelevant

But here a tidbit that goes into every single lecture deliver Comportment demeanor dress grooming and overall appearance constitute the first levels of information about ourselves that we offer to the observing world
They may not be the most important but they are the first which makes them worthy of effort and attention

What hope to convey to my audience members is that blending personal style and comfort preferences with environmental expectations can help you create looks that feel great and allow you to forget all about what you look like so you can focus on your message your work your passion
I also remind them that badly applied makeup is generally considered to be worse than no makeup at all and that it completely fine to skip it
I want them to feel confident and empowered and want them to think more about their goals than their shoes
By telling women that perfectly applied face of makeup is prerequisite for career success we are telling them that how they look is more important than what they know or what they have achieved

We are telling them that their natural faces will distract people that being pretty is necessary regardless of circumstance that performing femininity in exactly the right way isn just helpful it essential
Insisting that makeup become integral to professional woman daily life subtly tells her that if she doesn look right it won matter how smart or creative or innovative or capable she is
And that is patently untrue
Since ve admitted to being makeup novice myself realize may sound defensive
And maybe am
When read this spate of makeup career articles the underlying message got was If you don wear makeup you don look like grownup to other grownups
And that sentiment makes me want to break things
Some adult women wear makeup and others don
Learning to apply makeup is rite of passage for many but it is not skill set required for acceptance into the Grown Ass Woman Club
Any more than having children or going to college or losing your virginity or working outside the home or any of the other arbitrary markers of so called real womanhood are
Being woman can be done in infinite ways and forging successful career path can play out in infinite ways
Accomplished professional grown women can take on the world at any age at any stage and in any way they see fit
And they can do it with or without lipstick and foundation

Well there is no doubt that the stock market has entered correction mode
Brilliant statement right
Unfortunately this one may smack few investors in the face
Why
Well we haven had substantial correction in quite some time
By definition most would agree that correction is percent or more
In my previous post The Most Dangerous Time In The Stock Market talked about being lulled to indifference by long stretch of good times
So when correction takes place after these long calm times investors tend to freak out
While in the middle of these declines it absolutely impossible to judge whether it a slight dip or the beginning of more prolonged corrections
First want to share some statistics regarding how often the market corrects
Then will give you some suggestions on how to take advantage of the correction without the freak out part
Here are some stock market correction stats percent Corrections happen once every two years and last over days Remember each correction will be different
They will have different lengths frequencies and intensities
Now want to share some tips for avoiding the freak out and taking advantage of the correction
Invest regularly
Whether times or good or bad you have the ability to make additional contributions to an IRA or K
Adding money during decline allows you to buy more shares while the prices are on sale
Instead of giving in to the freak out during dip think of it as an opportunity to pick up some stuff cheap
Avoid jumping in and out
Market timing is fool game
You will do more damage getting in and out of the market
If you are long term investor stay put and weather the storm
Getting out when times are bad is fairly easy
It knowing when it time to get back in that is the challenge
Consider international investments or alternatives
If you think that the S market is not doing well why not add international investments to your portfolio
Not every country on the planet is in corrective mode
This may be the portion of your portfolio that performs well and helps your overall return
Consider adding some alternative investments like commodities managed futures or REITs
Most of these don move with the market
They do their own thing and may make money when the stock market is declining
Talk to your financial advisor
Your advisor will definitely have some words of encouragement that will make you feel better
An advisor can give you the perspective you need when you feel the urge to freak out over market correction
Have the advisor do an update on your financial plan
That way you can see just how much correction affects your long term goals
Remember market corrections are part of investing like it or not
Stick with your plan

Dear Readers According to January Schwab Money Myths survey no matter how savvy we think we are there are still lot of financial misconceptions floating around out there
And surprisingly number of those misconceptions aren about esoteric investing theories they re about everyday financial situations
To help you avoid these common misconceptions and perhaps help your loved ones avoid them too m going to share not only the myths but also the facts
After all little financial reality can go long way toward helping you protect yourself and meet your goals
Myth
A will is the best way to ensure your property will be distributed the way you want
That would seem to make sense
But the problem is that many people forget that they ve already designated beneficiaries on many of their financial accounts such as IRAs and on their insurance policies
Or they think that will overrides those designations
However the opposite is true
If there a discrepancy between beneficiaries named on your financial accounts and those named in your will your financial accounts will prevail

So while will is an important part of your estate plan you also need to update your beneficiary designations to make sure you don inadvertently leave something to an unintended recipient such as an ex spouse
Myth
It important to eliminate all debt by the time you retire
It really depends on the type of debt you have good debt or bad debt
Good debt is low interest and tax deductible such as mortgage
Bad debt is high interest and non deductible think credit cards
Your personal circumstances and tax situation will help determine how much debt to eliminate and when
To me credit card debt should always be the first to go
Myth After you retire you can always get another job if you need more money

Continuing to work at least part time is great idea for lot of reasons but the reality is that while more than one in three workers in our survey percent said they expect to get income from part time job in retirement only percent of those who are currently retired actually do
Often the reason has to do with health issues
Plus the current job market doesn make it any easier
Myth
Every adult should have life insurance
Do you have young children
Are you supporting other dependents
Do you own small business
Or do you have significant liabilities that will continue after you die
If you answered yes to any of these questions life insurance may make sense
Otherwise it could be waste of money
Myth You should start taking Social Security as soon as you re eligible
If you wait to take your benefits starting at age they will be percent higher than if you start at age
Of course you also have to factor in your current needs health spousal benefits and family history of longevity before you make this important decision
Myth You should purchase long term care insurance when you re in your or younger
It sounds right because younger people have lower premium
But on the other hand you ll be paying that premium for longer period of time increasing the total cost
Bottom line
If you re in good health the ideal time to consider long term care insurance is between ages and
Myth Retirees shouldn have their money in the stock market

While it often recommended that you decrease the percentage of stocks in your portfolio as you get older keeping certain amount in combination of stocks stock mutual funds and exchange traded funds ETFs is good protection against inflation no matter your age
You don want to risk money that you ll need in the short term but there such thing as being too conservative especially if you anticipate long retirement
Myth If you need cash while you re still working k plan is good place to turn for loan or withdrawal
To me k loan should be last resort unless it an emergency
First you re immediately depleting your retirement savings
Second you re risking taxes and penalties if for some reason you can pay it back on time
Third if you leave your job for any reason you ll need to pay back the loan ASAP
And finally regardless of when you pay back the loan you do so with after tax dollars which gets taxed again when you withdraw the money in retirement
Myth
By the time you re it too late to make difference in your financial future
Absolutely not true
You likely have plus years of saving ahead of you
More than third of working Americans in our survey don plan to retire until
If you save diligently and take advantage of catch up contributions for both s and IRAs those extra years can make significant difference in your financial future
If all of this seems obvious to you great
But don take anything for granted
The financial world continues to change and challenge us all
If you re uncertain about something get help
And be sure to talk to your loved ones especially your spouse
To me it important that both adults in household understand and share responsibility for money management decisions
Pass that knowledge and responsibility on to your kids and you ll be helping them take control of their own financial reality

Financial troubles do not often appear out of nowhere but if bad financial habits have become the norm you may not see the warning signs
Here are five red flags that you may be heading towards financial trouble
No Significant Savings or Emergency Fund savings account is necessity for any family regardless of your income
Some may prefer savings account that also functions as an emergency fund while others may prefer separate emergency account
The purpose of this emergency fund is to have money available when the unexpected happens
This could be something small like an unexpected car repair or big event like the loss of job
The amount of money needed for an emergency fund varies based on where you live and the expenses you have
Generally experts agree that there should be at least three months of income in the fund possibly up to year worth
Living without savings account or emergency fund is gamble that may land you in serious financial trouble
More from Manilla com How Day Financial Fast Saved Me Tons
Borrowing to Pay Other Loans Maxed out credit cards where users can barely pay the minimum due each month are true sign of financial trouble
Even worse are those who may find the need to begin borrowing at high interest rates for cash advances in order to pay other loans or bills
Borrowing from one credit card to pay another credit card or loan is cycle that can only be sustained for so long before you will be unable to keep up
High interest pay day loans used to catch up on bills are also bad idea and are usually response to living paycheck to paycheck
Take step back and evaluate your financial situation and what can be done to change it
No Health Insurance Living without health insurance or without enough insurance is risk not worth taking
While some may argue that the cost of health insurance makes this bet worthwhile one bad accident and you could find yourself over your head in medical debt
An emergency room visit or even very short hospital stay can stack up tens of thousands in medical bills very quickly
Make sure your insurance provides enough coverage to keep your family out of financial trouble
More from Manilla com Becoming Wealthy Starts By Thinking Like the Wealthy
Credit Denial Being denied credit should be like big warning sign saying You are in over your head
Most credit providers base this decision on credit history and credit score
A below average credit score can mean lenders will charge higher interest rate but when lenders stop approving you for credit all together this means trouble
A very low credit score can be caused by combination of many factors
Some of these factors may include your debt to credit ratio multiple late payments and your total amount of debt owed
Ignoring Debt Most families find they will have need for credit at some point
Knowing how to use this credit appropriately can be hard lesson to learn
Borrowers who choose to be ignorant of the amount of debt owed or the fact that there is no end in sight for paying it off need to make some changes quickly
Consumers can spend freely ignoring the climbing debt only for so long before financial disaster is in sight
Any loans or credit purchases should be made with plan for how and when they will be paid off

A few weeks ago the refund from my federal tax return was deposited into my bank account
I had two reactions almost simultaneously
The first was Woo hoo
Fun times
The second was should probably save this
Be responsible
d like to think that m not alone in my indecisiveness on this issue
After all tax season is one of those times when lot of people get money from the federal government
Of course the amount might vary with some people getting sizable check and others getting little
Nevertheless it a little pick me up for most of us
The sun is finally starting to shine
Trees are blooming
And hey here some money
As someone who studies psychology and consumer behavior tax season is also great research opportunity
It raises all sorts of questions such as why people file when they do whether they lie on their returns and most relevant to my quandary how people are planning to spend their refund
I got answers to these questions from survey we conducted at the Georgetown Institute for Consumer Research
Is Getting Big Refund Like Winning the Lottery
There seems to be general belief around this time of the year that if you re getting refund then you should spend it on something fun
All the ads urging us to go out and splurge certainly seem to think so
But is that really the case
Not quite
In fact consumers seem to view the refund as money they have been counting on
In the survey conducted by the Institute percent of respondents said they viewed the refund as money they were owed or as self imposed savings account
In other words consumers don view the refund as surprise gift from the federal government that they could party with
Instead this is money that many consumers have already allocated toward something
Given this perception of the refund the big question becomes what people are planning to spend their refund on
Where Is the Refund Going
For most tax payers it been tough few years
Though the recession began six years ago the effects are still being felt by most people

Consequently it not surprising that most survey respondents wanted to use the bulk of their refund percent of it on average in responsible manner g by saving investing paying down debt or making necessary purchase
But surely some people are planning to use some of their refund for something fun
Surely m not the only one who wanted to use some of my refund to indulge myself
Indeed m not alone
While large portion of the refund is going to be spent responsibly consumers are planning to use small portion for something fun
In fact about percent of the refund on average is being allocated for an extravagance
However some consumers plan to use more of their refund in this way than others
There were two factors in particular that influenced the extent to which the refund would be used to make an extravagant purchase
One of the factors is family structure
Consumers without children are planning to devote more of their refund percent on average toward nonessential purchase than those with children percent on average
This is understandable given that those with children are likely to have more financial burdens than those without children
The other factor that determines how much of the refund is allocated toward an extravagance is the amount of the refund
Who do you think will spend more of their refund in this way those who are getting relatively big refund at least or those who are getting small refund less than
I predicted that those getting big refund would be the ones spending more of it on an extravagance
However the data tell different story
In fact it was the people getting more money who were less likely to splurge
Among those who are getting relatively large refund only percent were planning to use at least some of it for purchasing treat
However among those expecting relatively small refund percent were planning to use some of their refund on an extravagance
Doesn that seem little crazy to you
After all if you re getting bigger refund you should be more willing to splurge little right
This might be the case but realized that it also possible that those getting small refund think it won be enough to make dent in their financial obligations
Consequently these consumers might conclude that it better to spend more of their refund on something nonessential
Problem Solved
So if you ve been wondering what to do with that refund money lying in your bank account then you could go along with what most consumers are planning to do
Use the majority of it in responsible manner and take small chunk to celebrate

Did you know today marks the st Tax Day in American history

So while you might be thanking Uncle Sam for your refund interestingly enough while April is the date that is engrained in everyone mind most taxpayers have no idea why Tax Day is on or around April every year

To help you understand where these traditions started here a little history behind Tax Day The History of Tax Day Years in the Making On February Congress ratified the th Amendment giving them the authority to enact an income tax
Prior to there were no income taxes other than those raised during the Civil War
When Congress passed the income tax law in joint filing couple that made more than in taxable income after all deductions was subject to one percent tax rate
With inflation that is equal to roughly now
So why is tax day on April
The first income tax day in S history was on March
Four years later Congress passed the Revenue Act which moved tax day forward by two weeks to March where it remained in effect until
Why the change to April

Historians believe there are two reasons that Congress chose to push income tax day to April first it gave the IRS month longer to go through the income tax returns imagine the piles of paper before the ability to file
Secondly it let Uncle Sam hang onto the collected money little longer before issuing refunds
Another interesting fact is tax day cannot fall on Saturday Sunday or holiday according to the United States tax code
Tax day can also not fall on April since that the date of Emancipation Day legal holiday in Washington C celebrating the freeing of American slaves

There a magical quality about movie stars from the Golden Age of Hollywood
As part of the studio system women would receive complete makeovers and regular beauty regimes to match up with the reputation the studio wanted to build around them
If young hopeful was signed hair and makeup were paramount to her success
A lion share of those glamour gal makeovers took place at the Max Factor Building which is now must see museum at North Highland and Hollywood Boulevard
A classic film buff was determined to add this museum to my itinerary on my recent trip to Hollywood
From the moment entered was greeted with Art Deco grandeur
Bathed in pink the great room features marble and gold columns built in shelving lined with memorabilia and vitrines filled with vintage Max Factor beauty products and paraphernalia
Blondes to the Left Redheads to the Right Beyond the impressive lobby are four beauty chambers labeled For Redheads Only For Blondes Only For Brunettes Only and For Brownettes Only
While some entered to have their hair and make up aligned others were completely transformed
Most people know that one of Hollywood most famous redheads Lucille Ball was actually not redhead at all
She became one at Max Factor
It also where Marilyn Monroe went from brownette to blonde
Each room contains photos of stars that got the Max Factor treatment and while all four are fantastic really loved the Redheads Only chamber
Photos of some of my favorites including Barbara Stanwyck Ann Sheridan and Rita Hayworth lined the walls
Of course Lucille Ball took center stage
While many Hollywood stars became redheads at Max Factor Lucy was probably the most famous in that both her overall hair color and make up combination was created here
To add to the fun s TV set plays the famous Vitameatavegamin episode of Love Lucy on repeat and an original setting of Lucy Ricardo china Franciscan Ivy pattern is on display
On another screen footage of Lucy holding court as head of Desilu Productions shows her looking lovely as businesswoman
The Blondes Only chamber includes bustier worn by Marilyn Monroe in How to Marry Millionaire and an article revealing her beauty secrets
There also contraption known as the Beauty Micometer which looks like something out of futuristic torture chamber
It is helmet of sorts that was designed to assess woman face from all angles and contours
Because the screen could easily magnify any flaw this device sought to seek them out and offer makeup solutions for them
A Brief History on Max Factor Just as with any museum visit this trip gave me the opportunity to learn about history invention and inspirational people
Until visited my only association with Max Factor was recalling Jaclyn Smith say Thanks Max in those sassy commercials she did for the cosmetic line which showed gratitude for its founder
I knew the products had long history in Hollywood but had no idea how long or how Max Factor the man revolutionized the cosmetics industry
Long before his beauty products were available to the masses Max Factor made his mark on Hollywood in the early days of cinema
A Polish immigrant Factor began by creating custom made wigs and makeup for the movies
Theatrical makeup didn translate well from stage to screen so Factor came up with what he called flexible greasepaint which revolutionized the industry because it didn crack
Factor was also famous for personally applying makeup to Hollywood stars to ensure they looked their absolute best on screen
Gloria Swanson Joan Crawford Jean Harlow Bette Davis Judy Garland and bevy of others all got the personal treatment
As such many of these stars endorsed Max Factor cosmetics for little money in exchange for publicity for their latest film
Many of these stars were regulars at the salon where even non celebrity clientele would get the Hollywood treatment
Catty Quips and Digs Abound
As immortalized in the Classic The Women beauty parlors are famous breading grounds for gossip
As such interspersed with the cosmetic and costume displays are some juicy framed quotes from silver screen queens
Here are three of my favorites Only two people in Hollywood ever wanted to meet Garbo and Mae West
Now ve met them both and can go home and lie down
Don think don know who been spreading gossip about me and my temperament out there in Hollywood where that film was made don hate Bette Davis even though the press wants me to
I resent her don see how she built career out of set of mannerisms instead of real acting ability
Take away the pop eyes the cigarette and those funny clipped words and what have you got
She phony but guess the public likes that
The Max Factor Legacy When Max Factor died in his company was at the height of its success
His son took over the business and continued its reputation as an innovator and leader in the cosmetic industry

Milestones included kiss proof lipstick actual kissing machines were made to test its endurance line of camouflage makeup that was used during WWII male line of products fragrances and eventually special industry lines created for television
Most of all it seems Max Factor revolutionized the beauty industry
He turned brownette starlets into redhead and blonde stars
He synchronized hair and makeup for the perfect look
Above all he paved the way for every woman to look like celebrity
The Hollywood Museum The Max Factor Building holds much more than the history of beauty that unfolded underneath its roof
It also home to the Hollywood Museum and as such it really contains something for everyone
There a dungeon that contains shrines to Freddy Kruger and Hannibal Lecter with original costumes and ephemera
On other floors there are wardrobe and props from television shows like Mad Men The Walking Dead and The Beverly Hillbillies
More to my liking

there are some great items like Cary Grant Rolls Royce gowns worn by Greta Garbo and Jean Harlow and room of photographs of stars gathering at awards ceremonies and watering holes like The Brown Derby
One of the wildest exhibits is actor Roddy McDowell entire guest bathroom which was lined with photos and memorabilia from his favorite silver screen colleagues
For fans of classic Hollywood the building the makeup studios and the overall museum are sensory overload and an absolute delight
I will undoubtedly return because couldn possibly absorb everything in one go round
Did mention there an original pair of the ruby slippers on display
In fact the helpful guide told me that exhibits rotate so there always something new to see
I only hoping next time can get gander at that kissing machine

Real coins or Bitcoin Which do you prefer when you travel
Bitcoin the alternative currency created in by an unknown founder has been making headlines and not always for positive reasons

But even as the currency potential suffered blow following the collapse of Mt Gox the first big Bitcoin exchange some early adopters in the travel and sports industries are still bullish about the value of this new way of doing business
These are few of the travel and sports related companies that accept Bitcoin Costa Rica Travel Market

After first hearing about Bitcoin Monica McIntyre director of Costa Rica Travel Market an online marketplace for Costa Rica hotel deals became fascinated she said by the idea of payment method that would allow us to reduce transaction fees from an average of five percent to one percent

Coming from Latin American economies where you get paid for credit card transactions up to days later where you pay up to seven percent for credit payment transactions and where the bureaucracy of banking obstructs business operations Bitcoin seemed like the perfect alternative to the tilted payment systems institutionalized in the real world
CheapAir com
The travel Website CheapAir com is another business that has has found the Bitcoin concept promising
The idea to begin using the currency originated when customer asked one of our travel advisers if we accept Bitcoin said Jeff Klee the CEO of CheapAir com
got wind of it and thought it sounded like an interesting idea
So did some research to determine how feasible it would be found out it would be very doable and we decided to give it try
Sacramento Kings This year this California based basketball team became the first major professional sports franchise to accept the alternative currency
Ben Gumpert senior vice president of marketing and strategy for the Sacramento Kings said Bitcoin provides convenient cashless and frictionless transaction never before seen by NBA fans
It fits with our broader mission
From Google Glass to drones to Bitcoin we re always looking for the most innovative and cutting edge technologies to further improve our fans experiences
Response from the Public
The feedback from accepting Bitcoin according to Klee has been positive
We cannot be more thrilled with the results since we started accepting Bitcoin he said
On the technical side things have worked really well
The integration was straightforward and there have been very few glitches no significant ones at all
From customer standpoint our announcement was very well received from the beginning and we ve gained quite few new customers because of it
Gumpert reported that the response has been very positive to the Sacramento Kings introduction of Bitcoin
We have seen purchases by our fans across number of products he said
We ve also had number of teams and several local businesses reach out to us asking for advice and telling us they re now considering Bitcoin
The Future of Bitcoin So will you soon be using alternative currency to make all your travel purchases
Probably not
In spite of his optimism Klee predicted that it will take while for some segments of the travel industry to adopt alternative payment options like Bitcoin
think it will be while before Bitcoin acceptance becomes widespread in the travel industry particularly with the airlines he said
First of all there is lot of legacy technology in place that makes it difficult to do something like introduce new form of payment
I also think the airlines are pretty conservative by nature and in most cases it not in their DNA to move quickly on something like this
On the other hand if Bitcoin use becomes more widespread think airlines stand to gain tremendously
In spite of recent headlines Gumpert remains confident about the future of Bitcoin
Every new emerging market experiences setbacks he said
We don believe one failed company signals the end to Bitcoin
We are confident in Bitpay the Kings payment processor
As we do in all aspects of our business we will continue to monitor and make adjustments as needed to ensure the ultimate protection for our fans
McIntyre also believes this is the start of something big

Yes the collapse of Mt Gox was hit to the image of Bitcoin but only in the eyes of those who still do not understand the different dimensions and benefits of the system e currency payment system digital ledger she said

think the incident will polarize bit further the current positions for those who like and understand Bitcoin the incident might be seen as part of the growing curve of this innovative tool something that will enable to correct and strengthen for those who have been skeptical all along the incident is great told you so
But all in all the incident will be forgotten soon and Bitcoin will survive in stronger form
Crypto currencies are the future of digital payments
It might be Bitcoin or it might be called something else but there is no stopping this just like there was no stopping the new world the Internet opened up

The thought of retirement can bring excitement and relief but for many people it can be unknown territory and can conjure up tremendous amount of anxiety stress and uncertainty hindering their ability to properly prepare and actually look forward to the future
When you re working in your s and you have an idea of what you need to pay for after school activities for your kids daily lunch out groceries your work wardrobe vacation you get the idea
It easy to plan and budget for these things in the present because you know how much you have coming in and how much is going out
Here are some costs you should be thinking about as part of your retirement planning so that you don find yourself ill prepared
Housing Housing is typically cost that gets downsized in retirement but that not true for all people
Even if you do move to smaller home or pay off your mortgage you ll still be responsible for property taxes and or homeowner fees if you live in condo or retirement community
Those could increase more quickly than you anticipate so you ll want to plan to have cushion in your savings to cover them

Increased leisure activities Most people retirement dream consists of spending more time with family and friends and doing things they never had the time to do when they were working whether that be golfing traveling visiting grandchildren or meeting old friends over meal or coffee

While this is no doubt great time to be doing all of those things these leisure pursuits also cost money and you might find yourself spending more on dining out and travel than you ever did while working
That said be sure to factor in plenty of room in your budget so that you end up with both the time and the money to enjoy these activities
Long term care and medical expenses

Unfortunately it can be very difficult to determine how much you might need to save for future medical expenses because it impossible to predict longevity health needs and government changes to medical programs
You may also want to purchase long term care insurance which can help cover expenses for home care or nursing services that are not covered by health insurance or Medicare and Medicaid
That said not only is saving enough to cover these costs good way to sleep more easily at night it also essential that you eat right and exercise in order to keep yourself as healthy as possible

We are in dangerous time in the stock market
It not dangerous time because of crisis or volatility
It dangerous time because investors start to become overconfident
We have not had substantial stock market correction in some time
One thing that always happens during these quiet stretches is that investors become lulled by good times
That sometimes gives false sense of security
That can lead them to behave rather badly
I ve seen plenty of investors get themselves in trouble during these quiet good times
I often compare it to the spring break college student dancing on the hotel roof
Sooner or later something really bad will happen
Here are few classics ve seen over my years
Borrowing to invest
really don know what people are thinking here
I ve seen them borrow on credit cards and home equity lines
Most of the time they think that the trade will go their way and they can pay the money back
My advice don ever do this
It never works out the way you think it will
Not doing your homework
Never never never invest in something you don understand
If your advisor has made an investment for you make sure you get it before you buy
You must do some due diligence on your own before investing
Some of the worst mistakes ve seen have come from buying and investment that people had no idea of what it was or how it worked
Frequent trading
This is truly recipe for disaster
Trading frequently to try to pick up some gains
The vast majority of investors that have done this have blown up their accounts
Trading more does not equal more return
Do your homework trade when necessary
If an investment has met your goal or something negative has taken place that is good time to trade
In other words have defined strategy in place before you invest
Taking too much risk
Overconfidence has led many investors to become more aggressive
Their logic is that if m making this return then if m more aggressive ll make more
It true but if the market goes the other way then you can lose more
Stick with your risk tolerance through good and bad markets
Impatience
Impatience will often lead us to use emotion rather than logic
Investing and emotion don mix
Impatience will get an investor to trade too early and therefore miss out on potential gains
In fact impatience can cause you to lose more money from selling too early and not waiting on the investment to rebound
Patience is virtue and necessity with investing
Stay calm
Going it alone
Of course ll say this one is mistake
Seriously though when times are good investors get overconfident in their ability to manage their own money
Everybody is an expert when things are good
It all looks so simple
It doesn help with all of the commercials web sites and ads encouraging investors to drop their broker
Let that first large loss rack up and the emotions start to kick in
Then the panic starts and more bad decisions
A great financial advisor will prove his worth in bear markets
Calls and meetings that are all designed to reinforce your strategy and keep you on track
So those are the classic bad behaviors that ve seen
Yes believe this is dangerous time in the market
When investors take more risk become impatient with returns and start talking about or acting on managing their own investments
Proper planning and investing is an art as well as science
Don give in to overconfidence

Even though ve been in an entrepreneurial family my entire married life didn realize until framed in the context of my son that fear of the unknown is the very thing all entrepreneurs must first embrace then learn to brush aside

We are all guilty of putting something off until tomorrow that can be done today
Even though the April deadline for filing federal individual income tax returns is ingrained in our memory many people still wait until the last minute to take action
While the deadline is growing close there no need to panic
For most taxpayers saving for retirement is one the most efficient ways to lower your taxes while simultaneously building nest egg
Following the last minute tips below can help you not only boost your tax refund but also kick start your retirement savings
Tip Contribute to an Individual Retirement Account IRA
One recommended way to reduce your tax bill is to open an individual retirement account or increase your contributions to an existing account
Contributing to an IRA not only helps raise your level of retirement readiness but placing money into the account can also lower your total taxable income
The more you contribute to the IRA the less of your income is subject to taxes for those that qualify
While anyone can contribute to an IRA and enjoy tax deferred growth not everyone can deduct contributions
Eligibility depends on your marital status and whether you or your spouse has retirement plan available at work
If you re single and don have retirement plan at work your IRA contribution is entirely deductible
Similarly married couples where neither spouse has access to retirement plan get full deductions as well
The idea here is that if your IRA is your only retirement plan the government wants to encourage you to use it fully
IRA contributions which are tax deductible up to if you re over can be made until April and often result in tax savings
Every dollar you contribute to traditional IRA reduces your taxable income for that year
If you do qualify for the deduction remember to specify that the contribution is for the tax year
If you don specify the year you could end up contributing towards your IRA which will decrease your tax bill year from now but won do anything for your current tax bill
Tip Claim Saver Tax Credit
This credit is often overlooked and seldom talked about

If you have an income up to for married filing jointly you can save for retirement and get tax credit worth up to for individuals and for couples if you contributed to qualifying retirement plan such as an IRA or
Tip
Fund Health Savings Account HSA
As healthcare costs continue to spiral funding health savings account can be another way to lower your tax liability while saving for unexpected healthcare costs in retirement
HSAs are tax deductible savings plans that allow taxpayer to save pre tax dollars for future healthcare expenses
HSAs are paired with high deductible health plan and are one of the most tax advantaged vehicles because contributions are tax deductible and qualified distributions are tax free
It is one of the few savings options that is completely tax free
The annual contribution limit for is if you re over for self only coverage and for those with family coverage and can be made until April
Save on Taxes and Grow your Savings All Year Around The biggest mistake made by taxpayers year in and year out is procrastination
Following the above tips will provide you with an immediate tax break to file your return but it also important to make sure you implement an effective tax strategy for the long term
Consider the following tips to get head start on lowering your tax bill
Tip Enroll in your Workplace Retirement Plan For many taxpayers contributing to tax advantaged savings account provides the greatest opportunity for tax savings
Contributing money to workplace retirement plan such as k provides you with an immediate tax deduction and tax deferred growth on savings
The money you contribute is tax deferred from both federal and state income taxes which means you don pay taxes on the contributions until you withdraw the funds typically at retirement age
For example if you are in the percent tax bracket and you invest year that of your salary on which you are not paying taxes
This reduces your annual tax bill on that by nearly one third
Furthermore contributions to the plan are deducted automatically from your paycheck making the process seamless for you
By contributing even small amount on regular basis you can works towards building retirement savings over the long term and pay yourself instead of Uncle Sam
Tip
Increase Retirement Plan Contributions Another way to lower your tax bill is to reduce your taxable income
If you re already enrolled in your retirement plan at work consider increasing your contributions
Money contributed to the plan is not included in your taxable income
You can contribute up to to your or similar retirement savings plan in
If you aren going to reach that limit and can afford to additional contributions will save you at tax time
If you are age or older or will be by the end of the calendar year and your plan allows take advantage of the catch up provision
In addition to the general deferral limit you can contribute an additional for total of
This means if you are years old this year and haven started saving for retirement you can contribute as much as over the next ten years tax deferred to your plan
Investing in your retirement plan now allows you the potential to grow your retirement nest egg tax free for tomorrow and get tax savings today
Tip Leverage Both Pre tax and Post tax Contributions
If your plan allows for both traditional pre tax and after tax Roth contributions evaluate which is better option with your individual situation
You also have the option to split the deferral types
While pre tax contributions allow you to contribute to the plan on pre tax basis Roth contributions allow you the opportunity to grow these contributions tax free

This is valuable feature if you believe your taxes will be higher when you retire since you will pay taxes on the contributions now based on lower tax bracket and pay no taxes on the earning when you retire
