By Paula Pant April is fast approaching and if you re like many people chances are your tax prep is somewhere on the spectrum between mild disarray to frantic panicked scrambling
There just something about doing our taxes that makes many of us revert to slacker college student mode waiting till the last minute to throw together that report we ve known about for months
But there is hope
There are plenty of last minute tax tips that can still save you hunk of change even in the th hour
So put down that shoebox of receipts take deep breath and read on
File Even If You Can Pay Don fall into the trap of thinking that if you can pay your taxes you may as well not file
You re going to wind up paying penalty either way but it will be much bigger if you don file at all
Consider this The penalty for failing to pay your taxes is percent of whatever you owe
So if you owe you ll be charged month
In contrast if you don file at all you ll be charged whopping percent of your outstanding tax bill
Instead of month you ll be looking at penalty of month for tax bill
Which would you prefer
Don Neglect to Pay If You re Getting an Extension Are you filing for tax extension
You still need to mail the IRS check
Filing for an extension does not exempt you from having to pay by the April deadline it just extends your deadline for turning in your tax return by six months
If you don pay you re still liable for that percent penalty
How do you pay if you don know exactly how much you ll owe
Give your best estimate
There are variety of free tax estimator tools online that can help you get basic idea of what you ll owe
You may still be charged interest and penalties for the remaining balance if you wind up making an underpayment but it will be considerably less than if you didn make good faith payment at all
If you can afford it make an overpayment just to ensure that you won pay penalty
Maximize Your Deductions and Credits One of the biggest mistakes taxpayers make is failing to take full advantage of every deduction and credit that available to them
Yes it will take you little more time but if you skip this step you re leaving money on the table
Whether you re an individual small business owner or anything in between chances are you ll qualify for some type of deduction
Here are some of popular examples
Are you homeowner
Your mortgage interest is tax deductible
Do you have child under age
Some childcare expenses are tax deductible at per qualifying individual up to maximum of
Did you pay for college for either yourself or your child
If your income falls under certain guidelines modified adjusted gross income of for single filers and for joint filers you may be eligible for tax credit
Are you lower income individual or couple
You may be eligible for an additional Saver Credit of individual or couple for contributing to your own retirement account
Maximizing your deductions is great idea for all taxpayers
But the qualifying activity paying mortgage interest paying for childcare had to happen last year
In other words this information can help you take advantage of the deductions and credits that you already qualify to receive
But it can necessarily help you qualify for more
In the next three sections let look at steps you can take today to retroactively reduce your tax bill
Contribute to Traditional IRA Most tax deduction strategies unfortunately require you to take action before the end of the calendar year so you may too late to knock chunk off your tax bill
But you re not totally out of luck
Even if you re up against the wire you can still squeeze some extra savings from your tax return by contributing to traditional IRA
If you do so on or before April and specify that your contribution is prior year contribution you could be eligible to deduct as much as from your tax return
Up to if you re over
Extra money in your IRA and tax deduction
I call that win win

Contribute to Health Savings Account If you have high deductible health insurance deductible for single coverage or for family you can snag additional savings by contributing to your health savings account or HSA
The maximum contribution for tax year is for individual coverage and for family coverage with an extra in catch up contributions if you re or older
And your deadline for making these contributions is April
In other words If you can move this money into your HSA account before this years tax filing deadline you can enjoy an additional tax deduction
Maximize Your Likewise you can make retroactive contributions to your account that apply towards last years tax bill
Move money into your and earmark this as previous year contribution
Like the HSA and Traditional IRA your deadline for making contributions is April
Double Check Your Return One final tip Don let your last minute rush lead you to make costly mistakes
Three of the most common mistakes taxpayers make are math errors incorrect Social Security Numbers and neglecting to sign and date their return
Use tax software or hire CPA or at the very least double check your math with calculator
Proofread everything to make sure you didn make any typos or transpose any numbers
And make sure the signature and date are complete before you hit send or put that envelope in the mail
Don delay your refund by carelessness
Get Head Start for Next Year The IRS estimates that percent of all taxpayers wait until the last two weeks to file their taxes
If this describes you you re still in luck
Follow the above tips to maximize your savings
Then do yourself favor and make date with yourself to start your return much much earlier
You ll thank yourself for it
If you are like lot of people balancing the financial needs of today with the financial needs of tomorrow is constant challenge
It can be really hard to protect our future self from our current self
Like most things the earlier we develop good habits around managing money for those future needs the better
I have asked many retirees the question If you could go back thirty years and give yourself advice about retirement what would you say
To no surprise one of the most popular answers is wish would have started saving earlier
To avoid giving the same response when you retire here are five habits that everyone can develop before turning
Keep track of everything in one place
Call it budget
Call it plan
Use Quicken sign up for Mint com create spreadsheet or keep it in special notebook
Whatever it is track your income assets and debts in one place
Even if you don like what it is telling you ignorance is not bliss in this situation
Your life clock keeps ticking making this harder the longer you put it off
Take advantage of any all savings plans offered at work
If your employer offers k stock purchase plan or other savings plan take advantage of it
Many plans offer an employer match k free money
Some enable you to purchase company stock at discount
Open an IRA
These accounts whether traditional or Roth offer positive tax benefit
If you put money in an IRA you create the opportunity for time and compounding to do their thing
Make it automatic
For many of us the key is to find those Set it and forget it strategies that enable us to make current sacrifices that we don see or feel and then let inertia take over
Payroll deduct contributions to k are good example of this
You could also sign up for mutual fund or company stock program that allows you to make small investments over time that come right out of your checking account
Actively manage your debt
Chances are you have lot of debt
It may feel like so much debt you don even like to think about it
Whether home mortgage debt student loan debt or credit card debt many of us spend little time thinking about it
With interest rates being low and certain debt having better tax profile than others lot can be gained by actively managing debt
Whether that means paying it off little quicker using less consolidating or refinancing there are often many things you can do to optimize your debt
Denial and avoidance is the worst approach
Life moves fast
Savings and debts can grow fast as well

The earlier you begin saving money and the earlier you begin managing debt the more likely you will be able to react to the challenges and opportunities that lie ahead as well as reaching the ultimate goal safe and secure retirement without regret over not saving sooner
So the worst has happened after calculating your tax return you owe money in taxes this year
Is there way to make lemonade out of the grand experience of forking over big chunk of cash
How about racking up some rewards points or travel miles on one of those rewards credit cards
Well it isn quite that simple
At MyBankTracker com we love credit card mileage and other rewards points but we also believe that it doesn make any sense to spend lot of money for too little reward
The good news is that you can pay tax bill with credit card but the downside is that the associated fees can be substantial

None of what follows is solid replacement for meeting with qualified tax planner with ample experience in managing debt and personal finances but the information will help you ask better questions along the quest to save money and get more out of the finance tools you have
Payment handling services The IRS website lists the percentage charged by third party services that allow you to pay by debit or credit card whether you file or pay by mail

Rates are as follows Do the math but weight the goals Since it costs money to pay with credit card it important to do the math to see if the gain in rewards points or mileage bonuses offsets those charges
However there are other reasons that are perhaps less tangible in terms of dollars that might make paying taxes on the rewards card smart idea
Will the amount paid in taxes and fees push you over spending threshold and into higher rewards bracket
Will the extra spending bump you into any other bonus category
If so then the associated perks might be worth spending few extra dollars
All of these factors depend on the terms of your card so it is important to look at the terms closely
Now for another caveat
You need to know how the bank that issues your credit card will treat the expenditure
Will it be treated like any other purchase or will it fall into the category of cash advance

Cash advance terms are usually more costly in the long term because the interest is usually higher and the non cash advance principle needs to be paid off before your monthly payments are applied to the cash advance balance
This means you are paying the higher interest rate for longer on cash advance
Other associated fees may also be incurred

Credit card convenience checks Credit card convenience checks might be an option to pay your taxes earn points and skip the fees paid to third party credit card processing services but may come with the same additional fees and balance principle problems as cash advances or worse
Know the terms before signing on the dotted line as every bank manages this differently for different cards and accounts
Read your user agreement carefully and call the bank to clarify
Ask for the details in writing in case you don have the most up to date terms

Know your payment habits None of what has been written above takes credit card interest rates into account and assumes the debt incurred from the tax payment will be paid off in full during the billing cycle to avoid accruing interest
If the debt can be paid off right away and the interest is high considering other options might be good idea
Perks aren worth much if the cost exceeds their value

With Tax Day fast approaching next week millions of Americans are no doubt scrambling to track down receipts bank statements and other important documents in bid to meet the April filing deadline
But the more you rush tax pros say the more you re likely to make mistakes that can cost you in the form of penalties delay in getting your refund and even higher risk of an audit
So if procrastination has gotten the better of you this year don worry you re not alone
Here are few last minute mistakes to avoid to keep your return error free
Overlooking Income
The IRS requires you to claim all income made in regardless of whether or not you received W or from an employer
Failing to disclose income is common issue for last minute filers and an oversight the IRS is keen to uncover
Maybe someone did one little freelance job back in February and kind of forgot about it and forgot to include it on their tax return says Lindsey Buchholz principal analyst with R Block Tax Institute
Those are the kind of things that the IRS can catch pretty easily
And once the IRS realizes you owe more you ll be on the hook for the extra tax plus penalties and interest
So even if you only worked side job for day the income you received is still taxable and you must claim it on your return
Messing Up the Math If you re pressed for time put away the pencil and paper
E filing is easier faster and more secure than processing your returns via snail mail and you ll avoid the long line at the post office come April

Another upside to filed returns You can eliminate mistakes like not understanding how to apply tax table or not doing the math correctly says Buchholz adding that online software will generally catch any errors you ve made along the way
The good news is that the IRS offers free tax software to people whose incomes are less than and free fillable tax forms for those who earn more
Companies like R Block and TurboTax also offer free simplified returns online
That said if you still prefer to file on paper take the time to run your figures through software program to make sure your final tallies are correct
RELATED
A CPA Spills The Biggest Tax Mistakes That See

Forgetting to Double Check Numbers and Signatures One of the most common tax mistakes according to the IRS is an incorrect Social Security number so make it point to check that you haven accidentally transposed the digits
And if you ve opted for direct deposit refund you should also make sure that your bank account information is accurate
Finally don forget to sign and date the return and have your spouse do the same if you are filing jointly
An unsigned return is like an unsigned check in the eyes of the IRS
It invalid
Missing Out on Deductions and Credits When you re rushing to file you are more likely to overlook credits and deductions that could save you hundreds even thousands of dollars on your tax bill
According to R Block one in five filers who prepare their own taxes disregard benefits losing out on an average of in either credits or deductions
Education credits in particular are missed quite often Buchholz says
There are several different kinds of benefits and it can be hard to figure out which one you qualify for and which benefits you the most
I think some people get stressed out about it and decide not to do it
Child care benefits are also often misunderstood says Koreen Jervis an enrolled tax agent with Korj Tax Professionals in New York City
People hear child care and they think day care she says
But they forget that when their kids do summer programs that also child care expense and therefore are eligible for credit
Tax procrastinators aren just subject to leaving money on the table either
They also run the risk of double dipping on deductions in their rush to file and running afoul of the IRS
People often forget that if they contribute to child care flex spending account they can also get the child care credit Jervis says
lot of people do that and then get letters from the IRS

Failing to Itemize Deductions For many people taking the standard deduction for couples or for single filers may seem like the simplest and easiest route when doing taxes especially if they re pressed for time
But itemizing your deductions can sometimes save you bundle
If you ve had large uninsured medical expenses made sizable charitable contributions or paid significant amount of interest or taxes on home in the past year itemizing may be worth your while
Not sure if itemizing is right for you
Take this quiz to find out
Not Asking for More Time It far better to opt for an extension than to file tax return full of mistakes
If it last minute your best bet is to file an extension Jervis says
It will give you time to really look at your options and make sure you aren leaving valuable deductions out there or making errors that can cost you later
Form it can be filed by mail or online gives filers an automatic six month extension on their returns
Misunderstanding Extension Rules That said just because you file an extension doesn mean that you don have to send in check on April if you owe taxes
In fact it one of the most common mistakes Jervis encounters
An extension is an extension on the return not on the payment she says
So even if you push off filing your return until October you need to be prepared to estimate your income and pay whatever you may owe come April adds Buchholz
Otherwise you will get penalties and fees

Lately have been having more and more conversations about changing portfolios
Change them how
you ask
By increasing the risk of the portfolio
In the plus years that ve been advising clients ve seen it during every bull market
Investors risk tolerance gets higher
They just get comfortable with it like it will last forever
On the flip side in bear markets everyone risk tolerance goes down
I ve said time and time again that you need to pick an overall risk tolerance for both good and bad markets and stick with it
Don change it with every movement of the markets
Sometimes investors will confuse recent successes and tend to be more aggressive
It can give you false sense of investment prowess
Then things turn south and you pay for it
So how does poor investor figure out their risk tolerance
With the help of an advisor of course
Start working with qualified financial advisor on this very important component of investing
Here are some questions that an advisor might ask you about your risk tolerance
What is your time frame
This is probably the most important question on the list
Risk is relevant to time frame
If you have decades to invest then it highly likely that you can weather the volatility of the markets and be more aggressive
However if your time frame is short you have less time to make up declines that will eventually take place
Would you choose this risk tolerance if the markets were down several thousand points
I think this question is real test of whether you would approach your risk tolerance the same way in declining market
If so go for it
If not then think twice about being more aggressive
How do you react to volatility
When you read the news that the market soars or dive bombs how do you react
Do you get upset check your accounts and pace the floors
Or do you blow it off and accept the fact that volatility is all part of it
Think about this
What do you do with existing investments
Do you change them and move out of stocks or do you leave them alone or even invest more
Your answers will determine what your risk tolerance really is
Determining risk tolerance is true art
It subjective and different for everyone
It where good financial advisor can earn his keep
Many financial advisors use tool called risk tolerance questionnaire
It has questions that try to determine your level of risk
I ve seen quite few risk tolerance questionnaires over the years
Some are terrible and some are very accurate
Use questionnaire but back it up with good advisor and the answers to the questions above
Risk tolerance really is that important
It will determine your long term happiness during bull and bear markets

There is no shortage of makeup advice these days
Everywhere you turn self proclaimed makeup experts are passing out advice on all the do and don ts of makeup application
In reality there are tons of makeup tips out there without any validation behind them
Below are some of the most common makeup myths that many people have fallen victim to
Darker foundations make you look tan In reality choosing foundation that is too dark for your skin tone only makes you look like you chose the wrong foundation
For the best results always match your foundation to your natural skin color
Makeup causes breakouts False
Bad hygiene causes breakouts
Make sure your face is clean before applying makeup and never sleep with it on
Proper skin care is the foundation to flawless makeup application
Pump your mascara for more product This practice does not work and it is one of the worst makeup habits have seen women have
Instead of pumping the mascara wand try to twist it out of the tube
Pumping your mascara will introduce air into the tube forcing in bacteria and causing it to become trapped
The inside of your mascara tube will become the perfect habitat for bacteria to survive and reproduce
This habit can lead to some nasty eye infections and can also cause the mascara to dry out and break down faster than it normally would
In order to practice safe mascara habits make sure you are replacing your mascara every days
Expensive cosmetics are better than inexpensive ones
The truth is there are good and bad products in all price ranges
It really doesn mean much to buy tube of lip gloss
Most makeup stores allow you to test products before purchasing and you should take advantage of this option whenever given the opportunity
Don just look at the price tag and assume you are getting what you pay for
Apply your concealer before your foundation The opposite is actually true
By applying your foundation first you will already cover up most of your blemish areas
Concealer is for the stubborn areas that cannot be covered with foundation
You will find that you save lot of time in your makeup application by applying your concealer after your foundation
There is no need to clean your brushes if you are only using them on your own face This falls into the category of proper hygiene
Brushes are breeding ground for bacteria
You should be washing your brushes at least once week
I don use any cleaning products on my brushes that wouldn use to wash my own hair
Brushes are expensive and are certainly an investment
Proper brush care will also allow them to last for long time
I have brushes that still look new after years of using them
Use an eyebrow pencil the exact color of your eyebrows
Matching your eyebrow color and filling them in will cause them to look harsh
Using shade or two lighter than your eyebrow color will allow them to look more natural when you fill them in
Waterproof mascara is better than regular mascara
This is wrong for so many reasons
Unless you are going to an event where you expect to be crying your eyes out or dunking your entire head underwater stay away from waterproof mascara
The main reason for this is that waterproof mascara is much more difficult to wash out than regular mascara
The actual actions of what it takes to properly remove it will cause you to pull out your eyelashes in the process
Every woman craves long luxurious thick lashes and can absolutely achieve that without waterproof mascara
In addition to this do not sleep with your mascara on
This can lead to your eyelashes becoming brittle and prone to breakage
It can also cause some pretty gross infections in your eyes

Early on in my childhood had my skincare routine down
After sitting in stinking bath of colloidal oatmeal would dry off making sure to gently pat my skin rather than rub
Then would grab big bottle of Eucerin or Aveeno depending on the season and would slather it on as my mom would call down the hall Are you putting your lotion on
And in response would roll my eyes Duh mom
In the summertime swam pretty much every day at the local pool but that meant rinsing off immediately and facing the harsh consequences of chlorine and the blazing sun
I had to take such care with my skin because of one problem eczema
If you ve ever experienced the rash you know it can be an irritating itchy mess
But it doesn always have to be that way
By knowing what to avoid you can go long way to preventing and improving outbreaks
talked to couple of dermatologists who helped me to understand what all sufferers adults and children alike can do to take care of their extra sensitive itchy eczema skin

What To Lookout For Fragrant soaps and lotions People with eczema should avoid covering their bodies with fragrance says board certified dermatologist Dr Adrienne Haughton the assistant vice chairman and associate program director of the Department of Dermatology SUNY at Stonybrook
Therefore all of the fragrant body washes from places like Bath Body Works should be avoided she says
But she adds if you have to have signature scent it far better to use fragrance spray that you can spritz directly on your clothes rather than your body
Household irritants This is especially important if you have kiddos who have the rash as they could accidentally come into contact with these items

Dr Haughton cautions against irritants like cleaning products and detergents which have harsh chemicals fragrances and acidic pH levels that when in contact with your skin can cause different reactions but if you have eczema they can inflame an already aggravated rash
Harsh beauty products Pay special attention to what you use on your face

For example Many anti aging products may be too irritating as well as makeup remover some sunscreens and acne products says Dr Haughton because of salicylic acid retinol and glycolic acid in these products that combat against oil meaning they will make your skin drier than it already is
Pets
Since eczema is thought to be an overactive immune system response and is often linked to other allergic reactions pet dander from both cats and dogs can contribute to flare ups
Exercise
According to Dr Haughton chlorine and sweat are two triggers for eczema
After going swimming it might be good idea to at least rinse off your body and if you re heavy sweater pay special attention to areas like the insides of your elbows and the backs of your knees
dirty environment Like pets dust mites and mold also stimulate allergic reactions such as rashes and hives they can show up in carpets rugs curtains bathrooms and various forms of furniture
To curb added irritation from the allergy inducing fuzz make sure to keep your surroundings as dust and mold free as possible so your own home won make you itch
The One Ingredient You Need To Know
Ceramides Dr Debra Jaliman New York City based board certified dermatologist advises the use of products that include ceramides which she says are very important for hydrating skin
Ceramides contain lipids the same fats that are found in your skin and do an outstanding job replenishing them agrees Dr Haughton
Basically ceramides are comprised of fatty acids and found in your epidermis they contribute to the water repellant layer of your skin which helps protect you from external drying factors
Although many people haven heard of them they are the main ingredient in heavy duty moisturizers like CeraVe
Recommended Regimen
Here are some daily practices that will help keep your eczema at bay
Use lukewarm water You should avoid hot steaming showers says Dr Jaliman and Dr Haughton agrees listing steam as trigger
Although long hot shower can be very relaxing remember that this can irritate the skin if you consistently shower like this day after day
Invest in some good wash cloths Use soft cloth or cotton pads to wash your face advises Dr Jaliman because they won tear or rub your skin the wrong way
Practice good hygiene overall Cleaning your body after long day is super beneficial as it will remove the bacteria that could be making your eczema worse
For example there are cases of eczema herpeticum which is viral infection that can be caused by poorly treated atopic dermatitis the typical rash you see if you have eczema
Eczema herpeticum involves lesions and boil like eruptions and if left untreated there can be some severe side effects such as blindness or death
Dr Haughton recommends that you seek medical attention immediately if you show symptoms such as boils on top of atopic eczema fever and swollen lymph nodes
Any patient with eczema herpeticum will need to be hospitalized for antiviral medications Dr Haughton says
As mentioned try using lukewarm rather than hot water for showers
The same rules go for cleaning your face which both dermatologists say you should wash twice day
Mind your towel manners After cleansing pat your skin dry says Dr Jaliman because the friction from the rubbing can cause additional irritation

Know when to apply ointments Dr Haughton recommends putting any topical prescription while the skin is still damp to the areas that are flaring she says adding that you should moisturize your entire body as final step

The goal is to trap in some of the moisture Dr Haughton says since the patches of rash caused by eczema dries out the skin and when good moisturizer is used like one with ceramides you ll have protective shield that will keep your skin hydrated not dried out

Credit cards are useful tool for managing purchases building credit and reaping rewards point cash back or travel points
Unfortunately the terms of credit cards change regularly and card which once had great rewards program might not be as enticing as it once was
Every year it a good idea to compare cards and ditch certain ones in the bunch
While you are busy preparing for spring cleaning around your house take the time to do the same for your finances including your credit cards
Do the math If you re enjoying the perks or credit card rewards from using certain card but it costing you more in fees than the rewards are worth it probably time to rethink using that card
Perks and rewards like travel miles always come at some cost but if the same benefits can be had for less through other programs ditch the card
Change in credit score When someone credit score drops it entirely possible that bank may change the terms of credit card issued to them
The result is usually higher interest and annual fees
However an uptick in one credit rating isn going to prompt the bank to upgrade the card
If you ve had credit card for long time and your credit score has improved you may be eligible for better offer but you have to ask
Call the issuing bank and ask if you qualify for any better programs or check to see if other companies have better deals

New offers New credit card offers might be available that offer similar features and benefits to cards you currently carry but may have great introductory offer like low rate on balance transfers bonus miles or some other program to sweeten the deal
If you re planning on going after another card be sure to call your current bank to see if they ll offer any incentives to keep you as customer
Changes in airline miles With airline mergers and difficult market many of the airline miles rewards programs have changed
Many customers are unhappy about changes to Delta mileage rewards programs and are looking for other travel bonus alternatives
Or maybe you aren flying as much and rewards based on frequent flyer mileage points aren as interesting as cash back or shopping discount programs
If making it into higher rewards status category with an airline mileage program isn realistic this year it might be time to rethink any credit cards you re carrying which offer miles

Likewise hanging on to credit card you re unlikely to use isn a great idea since the company will eventually close an account with no activity and paying annual fees for card collecting dust isn a wise use of money or credit line either
A caveat It important to remember that every time you apply for new credit card that information is calculated into your credit score
Too many inquiries into one credit history in short period of time can have negative effect on your credit rating so choose carefully and don apply for every offer you find
Also if you do end up closing certain cards be sure to read this article about the Pros and Cons of Canceling vs Cutting Up Your Credit Cards
Even if you convert credit card into another one through an existing relationship with bank you might get ping on your credit report

If you know what your credit score is before applying for card you can call in and ask about what the minimum score income and other factors required to get into different program before actually submitting the application

By Christine DiGangi Credit com It a good thing to be punctual especially when it comes to financial matters
Credit scores rely heavily on your payment history so developing habit of making on time payments will help you improve and maintain high credit scores
While tax information isn generally reported to credit bureaus missing the deadline for paying the IRS could result in tax lien which could seriously damage your credit
But in general that the only way tax related information goes on your credit report
What a Tax Lien
It pretty simple If you don pay your taxes the IRS can file notice of federal tax lien with the credit bureaus and that a huge negative on your credit reports
If you owe more than the IRS automatically files the lien after taxes have gone unpaid for days the threshold increased from to in
At that point you could see possible point slide in your credit scores
All is not lost if that happens to you said Gerri Detweiler director of consumer education for Credit com
You need to look into the Fresh Start program to get into an installment agreement
She referencing payment plan that allows the IRS to automatically debit taxpayer bank account each month until the taxes have been paid
If an eligible taxpayer has enrolled in the installment plan he or she can request the lien be withdrawn
Unlike other debts the IRS installment plan payments will not be reported to the credit bureaus so that aspect of the lien will not impact your credit
Other Credit Consequences There are other ways taxes could hurt your credit which is why you should carefully consider your payment options
Failing to pay your taxes on time may not always hurt your credit but it could contribute to credit problems
First of all missing the April deadline may subject you to late payment penalties which the IRS outlines on its website
You ll end up having to pay more and the effect of added expenses could put wrinkle in your ability to meet other debt obligations
If you decide to pay your taxes with credit card or personal loan there the potential you could see some negative impact on your scores
Adding to your debt load can affect your credit scores as it raises your credit utilization and if you end up struggling to repay the loan poor payment history will have similarly negative effect
When considering how to pay your taxes give your credit scores look

You can see two scores for free using Credit com Credit Report Card and the information may help you determine whether you can afford to temporarily add to your debt load or if you can qualify for personal loan

Having plan to pay off debt is one thing
Setting that plan into motion is whole different ballgame
Arguably the best approach to getting out of debt is called the debt snowball
Here how debt snowball works The debt snowball works because you pay more than just the minimum payments each month
The result is getting out of debt faster and with less paid in interest
You can structure your debt snowball in different ways
The most mathematically sensible option is to pay your highest interest rate debts first
This will save you money in interest and get you out of debt the fastest
Another option perhaps the more well known is to pay your debts from smallest to largest
This option can give you psychological boost
You gain quick victory over that pesky medical bill and you re more likely to stay on track
Of course all this assumes that you ve got some extra money to start paying down that first debt
But what if you re already living paycheck to paycheck and can find spare change hiding in the couch cushions
If this is your situation here are four ways to get your debt snowball rolling
Lower your bills
Before you try to exist on Ramen just to cut down your grocery bill look for ways to save on recurring bills
It more effective to cut down bills like cable cell phones Internet and insurance
This option results in month after month savings with very little effort
Start by checking out your list of monthly bills and try tackling the most expensive first
If for instance you re paying fortune for your cell phone plan shop other options
Increased competition means many companies are offering excellent deals for new customers
Or find ways to cut back spending with your current provider
Drop the data
Downgrade to cheaper phone
Or move away from your unlimited everything plan to more limited plan that still meets your needs
As you lower your monthly bills keep track of exactly how much you re saving
Whether it on your Internet bill or on your car insurance that money needs to go back to debt payoff not towards unnecessary spending
Sell some stuff
Chances are likely that you ve got some stuff sitting around your home
Stuff you don need or use
Probably some stuff you don even want
Instead of letting it collect dust take time to sell this stuff
Craigslist is great place to sell unwanted furniture and appliances items that would cost more to ship than they re worth
And for smaller or higher end items especially collectibles try eBay
Or take gently used clothing and toys to local consignment shops
Man vs Debt guest poster Jenny Newcomer paid off in student loans in nine months by selling stuff on eBay
But even if you make nowhere near this amount an extra few hundred bucks can get you started on your snowball
Start side gig
So many jobs and businesses out there can bring in extra money on the side while you still work your day job
Start blog
Deliver pizzas
Wait tables on the weekends
Consult on an hourly basis in your own field of expertise
Babysit on Friday nights
Stephanie Hood is just one example of the power of the odd job
She used babysitting paid focus groups and odd jobs on Craigslist to help pay her in student loan debt
Bottom line do what it takes
Even an extra week which you can make in no time makes difference as you get your debt snowball rolling
Reduce your interest rates One oft overlooked way to pay down debt involves refinancing
Getting better rate on your car loan or credit card debt can make huge impact on your get out of debt plan
Virtually any debt can be refinanced
Whether you are dealing with mortgage home equity line car loan or even credit card debt check to see if lower interest rate is available
Credit cards are arguably the easiest to refinance as there are plenty of percent deals to be found
By lowering the rates you free up more cash to put toward the balance of your loans
It Okay to Start Small
When it comes to paying off debt many people think in terms of go big or go home
But that just not how it works especially if you re already struggling financially
You can pay off debt little at time
You just need plan and way to get started
Any of these four options can give you some cash to get your snowball rolling
And as soon as you start paying off those small debts your payment snowball will grow
Once you get to the biggest debt on your list you ll smash through it in no time flat

You have to recognize the drill by now
Right about this time every year the financial doomsayers stand up behind their pulpits and declare that the end is near
Americans aren saving enough to retire much less pay off their debt
We re doomed the sky is falling and so on and so on
Have you noticed this story seems to pop up each year right about tax filing time
Is this an odd coincidence or something else
Whatever it is let look at the facts and see if we can make some sense of what is really going on
Why Personal Savings Sucks More than the new Star Wars From one perspective it appears that consumers are back to their old ways
Yes it is true that there were lot of cutbacks in consumer spending since the beginning of the Great Recession
Yet now that the money news seems to be more upbeat and positive many consumers have responded by upping their spending
Actually in an unwelcome sign for our national economy the level of consumer debt is increasing again the same way it was prior to the recession
If debt is increasing it makes sense that the savings rate is flat or stagnant
You can see this in the results of recent survey conducted by the Consumer Federation of American along with the American Savings Education Council
This survey was conducted at the end of special promotional event to encourage Americans to save more called America Saves Week learn more here
This survey revealed that percent of those surveyed reported their savings progress as either none or fair
Uh oh not looking so good after all
Should we be concerned
Yes and here are the reasons why You already know that private pensions are pretty much done and gone
As far as government pensions
Well you know that strapped local governments throughout the nation are doing whatever they can to get out weasel out
from under their pension obligations
To add fuel to the fire there is also dismal participation rate in employer offered retirement options such as plans
Is there anything you can do
Yes read on
Things Spock Would Say About Personal Savings
You have to take charge of your own personal finance
Wake up smell the poop you just stepped in and resolve to take care of it yourself
It is illogical to expect that your government is going to take care of you or to hope that you are the next winner of the Powerball Lottery
At this point we don even know how much longer Social Security will even be around
Have you noticed they keep pushing the eligible age further and further away
Doing Personal Savings the right way
Google personal savings tips and you will be handed more solutions than you could ever possibly use
That being said one commonality to take note of is the importance of making savings priority
Some personal finance advisors even advise paying yourself first
This is ridiculously easy nowadays with options such as payroll deductions auto debits from your checking account and the like
Consider unconventional strategies
No this is not about investing in exotic metals or any other such nonsense
This is about pulling your head out of the sand and taking good look around
Look at what working and what not
For example did you know that many checking accounts offer higher interest rates than savings accounts
What is that all about
Who cares
Just take note and position your money appropriately
That being said if you are concerned that you or your spouse will fall for the temptation to spend the money in checking account just open another checking account
Then transfer the money from one account to the other
In other words take advantage of the higher interest rate by stashing your emergency funds in another checking account instead of measly zero percent interest savings account
Another strategy is to take good hard look at your retirement savings plans and the like
Consider overhauling your retirement plan options
For example there are real action steps you can take today as explained here
As you can see the naysayers may indeed be correct about the average consumer savings
However that should not matter to you
The real power is in your hands
Now its up to you to step up to the plate and do something about your personal savings

These are two questions recently answered when sat down with Chad Saville the Editor in Chief of Beautiful Savage magazine an indie mag that boasts finding the beauty in an aesthetic that often challenges your perspective and your comfort zone

On the eve of their spring issue launch we discussed the meaning behind Beautiful Savage controversial men issue that explores new ideas around masculinity while providing us beautiful and stimulating visuals to tell their story
Saville has always been writer
His fascination with glossies as kid pushed him to study journalism in college
While pursuing this career it became clear that journalism in the traditional sense wasn a great fit for him
He ditched that idea all together and got into digital
Little did he know that this path would lead him right back to writing and creating content in new and exciting ways
Without the backing of traditional editorial experience Saville and few of his Brooklyn buddies started Beautiful Savage magazine

They saw the white space in the market which was that space in between traditional glossies and magazines displaying an aesthetic that was visually beautiful but had an underlying challenging or dark theme
Art that makes you feel challenged or conflicted in some way that the feeling m always trying to get to says Saville

The lines between masculine and feminine are blurred says Saville

He saw many of the men issues and wanted to make them better darker and cooler while still pushing boundaries

who are creating on their own terms

I met Erin Hazelton when she was writing for fashion magazines in New York City
This was more years ago than care to remember but she looks the same
What struck me the first time saw her and still what strikes me every time see her is how she exudes pure elegance
She reminds me of my godmothers whose style tips wrote about here and indeed their style philosophies are not that far apart
Erin Hazelton Courtesy of Erin
Last week in Geneva we met at the Mirror Bar of the Metropole Hotel in Geneva and couldn help but make her promise to put her style philosophy in writing
Here are her tips
Which means two things for me
First am going to clean out my closet
Second when she comes to Washington DC next weekend we are going to go shopping together
Thank you Erin for being an inspiration of style and of substance
As told to me by Erin Hazelton
Fashion
As Diana Vreeland once said Too much good taste can be boring
To offset this truth often find myself using leopard as neutral
There is fine line between being vulgar and interestingly chic
That said never take your clothes too seriously
A little touch of humor or extravagance can make an otherwise uninteresting look seen instantly smart
Keep it neat
If you are going to wear something oversized on top keep the bottom skinny
If you are going to wear billowing trousers tuck in your top to show off your waist or opt for something that is closefitting or waist skimming otherwise you risk looking messy
Erin Hazleton Courtesy of Erin
Dress for your body type not for the latest trends
A cropped top and high waisted trousers is current look like but that doesn mean everyone should wear it
Learn to work with your body highlighting the parts you like
Belt small waist
Show off your shoulders
Camouflage the parts you are uncomfortable with
Narrow shoulders and no boobies
A deep creates some shape up on top
My best friend thinks her hips are too big but she has tiny waist so her favorite proportion is full skirt with high waist
Poof
Her hips are hidden under swish of fabric only her tiny waist left behind to be admired
I ve also adopted this look for myself but for the opposite reason my hips are too narrow and like to give the illusion of more hourglass shape
If you don like your arms don wear sleeveless tops even if you love the top
You aren going to feel comfortable wearing it your arms constantly on your mind
If you don feel great you don look great
Lulu Lemons are wonderful and flattering but they are intended for the gym and at stretch grocery shopping on your way home from the gym
Try to wear real clothes when you are not working out
A boat neck is always flattering and elegant
My mother taught me to always buy high quality coats shoes and handbags
They are the things you use everyday and the things everyone will notice first
It almost spring show off your ankles
Trousers that hit just above the ankles are always chic think of Grace Kelly and Audrey Hepburn
Pair these trousers with flat sandals or college loafers for day and choose an elegant pump or high heeled sandal for evening
Which brings us to shoes
Just say no to big platform pump
I don care how short you are there is no excuse for looking like stripper
If see another actress walking the red carpet in pair of these uniformly colored hooves m going to start petition
If these kinds of shoes are hidden under floor length gown fine no one can see them
But if you can see them
No
Absolutely not

If you need height opt for sculpted wedge or an over the top Miu Miu proclamation platform or shoe with subtle hidden platform but if you think two inch platform is invisible because it the same color as the rest of your shoe guess again
d sacrifice an inch or two of height in the name of fashion any day
Everyone should own nude shoe
Because the shoe matches your skin tone there is nothing highlighting where your leg ends which helps to give the illusion that they go on for much longer than they actually do
I ve never heard anyone complain that her legs look too long
Whether it a flat sandal simple pump or high heeled sandal in the perfect shade of nude you can go wrong they go with everything
I usually pair mine with floral prints or bright colors nude and red is classic combination
The black pump
It seems obvious but there is nothing more useful than black closed toe pump
Elegant and timeless this shoe adds quiet elegance to any look
A slight point to the toe is more modern and helps to add elongate the leg
If you feel your outfit is boring the best way to make it more dynamic is to dress it up with an embellished shoe
Leopard print gold or beaded and embroidered are among my fancy shoes of choice
Other accessories
Just like on Wall Street more is never enough
A little gold letter on chain around your neck isn going to change your look but huge cuff on each wrist
Or shining statement necklace or oversized Eddie Borgo tassel necklace peering out from under white button down
Kind of brilliant
Too loud
you say
Open up any Crew catalogue and ask yourself again
Prodigal is the new preppy
Don be scared of fancy cell phone cover
A golden gate motif bejeweled peacock Chanel perfume bottle on chain or cover entirely encrusted with pearls
Why not
Cell phones are already kind of obnoxious
Embrace it
Pearls never go out of style
Never
I a big fan of wearing them in more sensual or slightly punk way never too literally
I love pearl choker Dior pearl piercing or one of Ana Khouri pearl ear cuffs
I leave the tidy boring single strand to my mum
Handbags are another great way to add some character to look
Never buy boring one
If you go for classic shape why not buy it in red or kelly green
That said it is difficult to wear color everyday so you will inevitably resort to black brown or nude everyday bag we all do
This everyday handbag is the one you will wear most so while it may feel boring it has to go with everything make it special
Let this bag be the one you spend the most on
Go for luxury
Herm is obviously the ultimate choice but perhaps not the most realistic
Look for bag by your favorite designer or brand and make sure it not an it bag one that you ve seen in every magazine or on the arms of all of your girlfriends
You want it to last not look dated by next season
You also need to make sure it is big enough to hold all your stuff and has shoulder strap
Being dominated by your handbag isn chic but being able to maneuver your way through the day with both hands definitely is
If you the bag passes these tests hold you breath and blow the better part of your paycheck
This is an investment piece
Erin in Alaia Courtesy of Erin Hazleton
Beauty
Take care of your skin
Figure out what works for you and stick to it
The worst thing you can do is to constantly change your beauty routine
You ll aggravate your skin
I like gentle cleanser lightening serum light moisturizer with SPF for day and something bit heavier at night
Find an eye cream targeted to your issues dark circles puffiness fine lines
I also use gentle at home tri weekly peel to keep my pores clean and my skin glowing
A light foundation hides multitude of imperfections
Even skin tone is must
Find great foundation that perfectly matches your skin
like invisible formulas like Giorgio Armani Maestro Fusion Make Up and Koh Gen Do Manifanshi Moisture Foundation
Apply with your fingers or foundation brush and then cover up any residual spots and under eye circles with cover up swear by like Kevyn Aucoin The Sensual Skin Enhancer
Mascara or discrete eyelash extensions are really all you need to finish your makeup look for day
Healthy looking skin and long lashes can take you quite way
If you need more bronzer or taupe brown eye shadow brushed in straight line and blended under your cheekbones adds instant definition
A bright pink or apricot blush on the apples of you cheeks makes you look fresh and awake
Like you just ran K
Try to keep your nails neat
If you don have time to paint them cover them with clear coat of shine
This will also add an extra layer of protection against splitting and chipping
If you do have time for color m partial to the classics only using reds almost invisible pinks and the occasional beige
go wild with jewelry but nail art terrifies me

Hair is tough one
I love to get blowout every other day but that not realistic more like once every three months

Keep travel sized brush in your handbag or car and run it though your hair when no one looking preferably not in public and you ll look like you just walked out of salon until the wind hits you then game over

Chances are your natural color looks pretty good even if you find it boring
Un chemically treated hair often looks healthiest and it won go brassy or green after few months
If you do need to color opt for natural vibrant shade and then take good care of it
Nothing looks worse than dried out locks ratty roots and artificial color

That always stayed with me and standard often follow

When you first learned to drive car you probably didn handle the car like NASCAR racer you fumbled around with the stick shift or hit the accelerator too hard maybe even running up on the curb
Watching beginner in any field is ugly
It the same with investing
Like any skilled craft it takes practice and discipline
Unfortunately the stakes are higher than in most fields sometimes your life savings are at risk

Retail investors that is everyday people and not corporations face two seemingly unpalatable choices Step into the arena of the financial markets and place their savings at risk or park their money in savings account and let inflation erode the value of their money as the years pass by
Fortunately the dilemma is more imaginary than real
Average people can profit from investing by learning to mitigate risk
Investing well is lifelong pursuit but little knowledge can prevent you from making disastrous mistakes with your finances
In my own career ve seen amateur investors make the same mistakes repeatedly with cringe inducing results
In the police line up of bad investments these are the usual suspects
Steer clear of them and you ll avoid getting mugged by the markets
Investing in industries you don understand
Several years back came across the executive of local bank who had owned large chunk of stock in his own company
Sometime in the late on the advice of broker he liquidated most of this stock and decided to diversify his investments
At that time the stock market was in the middle of the dot com boom and investors were throwing money at start up companies completely overlooking the soundness of these companies as businesses
Mr Bank Executive had friends who invested in tech stocks and earned absurd returns of percent or more per year and of course he wanted to cash in on the stock bonanza
He invested exclusively in software companies even though this guy never used the products they produced or had more than vague idea of what they did
You can guess what happened by he had lost about two thirds of million dollar portfolio after the dot com bust and the post September slump demolished the companies he had invested in
The moral is this If you want to pick your own stocks as opposed to letting fund manager do it for you you must do your research and look at the fundamentals of the company
Warren Buffet the richest investor in the world spends countless hours examining the SEC filings and shareholder reports of the companies in which he invests
He repeatedly warns investors to stay away from companies that make products and services they don understand
Basing calculations solely on past results
Around or so our company advised client who owned successful auto parts business
He was middle aged with years of business experience under his belt and roughly million dollars in savings that he was looking to invest
Mr Business Owner found sure fire method of picking stocks Look at stock chart find the stocks that had risen the fastest in the past and invest in those
His reasoning rested on the assumption that the stocks that had risen in the past will continue to rise in the future because the future must always resemble the past

But of course applying such crude logic to everyday life would yield ridiculous results If you lobbed hammer into the air you wouldn assume that it would continue to rise infinitely simply because it had continued to travel upward for the last few seconds
The key to selecting stocks is to find companies that are undervalued with potential for growth and buy them before their value increases

Though our guy method seemed logical on superficial level it revealed fundamental misunderstanding of the market Sometimes an increase in stock price can be sustained because the stock is overrated or the company has maxed out its potential for growth
As result of this mistake and other errors the business owner lost about of his portfolio value
Eventually he turned the entire portfolio over to my company and we were able to help him recoup his losses with more nuanced investing approach
Focusing on the level of return only
Mr Business Owner made another gross error

He developed kind of tunnel vision that caused him to look at the growth of particular stock without any regard to risk which led him to invest mainly in small cap and international growth stocks while neglecting safer but duller blue chip stocks
His goal was to earn percent annual return on his stocks
But of course you don get something for nothing in order to make that kind of return you have to assume heavy risk burden that he ultimately couldn stomach
As result he ended up selling his stocks when the market bottomed out and using the money to buy low yielding certificates of deposit
This brings me to the next point
Pulling your investments in and out of the market at random intervals
Another client of ours was an office manager who had healthy amount of money in k account with her employer who managed her funds prudently
However she sliced off section of her savings calling it her fun money and decided to get higher rate of return by investing it on her own
Luckily she invested most of this money in reliable blue chip stocks
Her stock choices were fundamentally sound but the problem was her inability to pick strategy and stick to it
Several times the markets got rough and even her blue chip stocks underperformed
She then called me and my partner and directed us to sell off her stocks
She told us that she wanted to get out of the markets protect her wealth and wait until the market got better
How do you know when things will get better
we asked her
It not as though bell will ring and tell you when the markets are safe
She replied feel it in my bones that it time to get out
Against our advice she pulled her money out of the stock market and placed her money in low interest CDs
Naturally when the market started to go up again she regretted her decision and directed us to reinvest the money in stocks
And then you guessed it stock prices would decline she would pull the money out and the same pattern would repeat itself
This client had an uncanny knack for doing the wrong thing at the wrong time
Her intuition was the best predictor of short term stock movements that the world had ever seen except that stock prices always moved in exactly the opposite direction of what she expected

If she had left her money in the stock values would have eventually returned to their previous levels she would have recouped her losses and she would have started earning profit again from the power of compound interest
Instead over period of four years she ended up losing about half of the she had invested
You might be conservative investor or an aggressive investor but you need to decide on an investment strategy and stick with it
In the long run the markets tend to move upward
If you keep moving your investments in and out of stocks then you re depriving yourself of the ability to earn interest on your money
Dumping your life savings in one investment
Will company be the next Google or will it be the next Enron
No one knows really
Market analysts can devise sophisticated metrics and analyze the company finances but no one can really predict whether company will succeed or fail
That why financial planners keep repeating the mantra of diversification
Of all the lessons of investing this is the most important
I ve seen lack of diversification produce some disastrous results
A case in point Before the housing bust my company took on another local businessman as client this one the owner of successful construction business
At age he had become self made millionaire in ten years creating business worth million
During meeting with him we found that his entire net worth was completely tied up in his own company he even had an unpaid mortgage on his home
Though the business was doing well at that time we saw red flag It unwise to put all of your wealth in any one investment no matter how sound it appears

So we advised him to save off about million of his equity in the company and use the money to pay off his mortgage and set up well diversified portfolio of stocks CDs municipal bonds and alternative assets oil currency commodities etc
He only partly followed our advice He invested some money in municipal bonds but then turned around and put the bonds up as collateral on bank loan to buy new equipment
Around the great housing bust hit California and our client construction empire crumbled
Demand for building slowed down revenue dried up and he could no longer pay his creditors
His construction business collapsed
The bank repossessed the municipal bonds when he stopped making loan payments
And to add insult to injury he even lost his home
He ended up bankrupt
It was stunning reversal of fortune
I admit that this is an unusual worst case scenario
But lack of diversification can be serious wealth assassin
No investment method is foolproof if anyone tells you otherwise hold onto your wallet
Taking the right precautions however keeps risk to minimum

If you don feel comfortable making your own investment choices then it okay to turn your portfolio over to professional fund manager after all not everyone feels confident enough to install the wiring in their house or fix the transmission in their car
Sometimes professional can save you time and money
Always remember your money is fragile resource so handle it with care
Photo Credit kjekol via Getty Images Many of the editors here at The Huffington Post are proud glasses wearing girls
But like lots of women when we throw on our eyeglasses we tend to neglect doing our makeup
No one really going to notice our crooked cat eye liner behind our tortoiseshell frames right
Wrong according to Bobbi Brown
The makeup artist and cosmetics creator believes that most women who wear glasses need to at least put on mascara and liner
While that might sound pretty simple Brown is making it foolproof with her book aptly titled Everything Eyes
Inside the page beauty book Brown breaks down simple tips like the five essential brushes you need to do your eye makeup and what to look for in an eye cream
Plus the second half focuses on how to choose the perfect glasses for your face shape and personal style
After spending hours delving into Everything Eyes we ve rounded up seven makeup mistakes girls who wear glasses should avoid
Check them out below
If your brows are messy and unruly apply clear brow shaper AFTER color application
This mascara like wand with liquid color both tames and defines brows
For subtle look you can simply brush up your brows with brow shaper
If you have lot of under eye darkness skip lining the lower lash line as it will only draw attention to the problem
Instead apply waterproof mascara to the lower lashes
To soften the line just use your finger or cotton swab to smudge slightly
Powder liner can soften too harsh gel liner and make it look diffused
Always curl your lashes before you apply mascara otherwise you may break your lashes
Crimp at the base of the lashes then hold the curler for to seconds as you lift up and go
Just once is enough
For quick pick me up hold the lashes in curl with your fingertips for few seconds
The glass in your frames can highlight under eye discoloration and darkness
So corrector and concealer underneath the eye and in creases is essential
Apply corrector with brush to the inner corner of the eye area placing it only where you see darkness
Then gently blend with your fingers
Next clean your brush with tissue before applying concealer
If you have redness around your eyes stay away from shadows with red or purple undertones
These colors will exacerbate the redness
For foolproof eye layer shadows from light to dark
Start with the palest shadow as the base then layer medium shade and apply the darkest shade last
The color of your eyeshadow shouldn compete with the color of your glasses
If you want to do the same color as your frames on your eyelids try base hue that a shade lighter and go few shades darker for the crease color
Finish with black liner and mascara
When you have mix of confident colors on your hair lips and frames keep your eye makeup simple
Go clean with only little liner and mascara eyeshadow isn necessary

While she was on hold she made more calls one to friend at the FBI another to the FTC and the last one to me
Mallory had just become statistic
The aftermath of tax identity theft is messy and since the number of victims has been on the rise

Millions of Americans who expected refunds often desperately needed to make ends meet have waited the better part of year to get their money back and even then only after they had traversed paper labyrinth to prove to the IRS they had been the victims of crime
Like many of us Mallory thought she was doing everything she could to protect her identity from this kind of crime and as former senior banking executive she probably was
Unfortunately we live in world where breaches and the resulting cases of identity theft are rapidly becoming the third certainty in life
Doing everything we can do is no longer good enough too many organizations have too much of your information in databases that are too easily accessed by the wrong people
Though most people don know enough about this kind of crime the IRS investigations of tax related identity theft are up percent since
The agency says it has identified million false returns and stopped billion in fraudulent refunds since then but the problem continues to grow

Victimization is so rampant that the two most popular DIY tax software programs R Block Tax Software and Intuit Turbo Tax now offer window for tax identity theft victims to input their IRS issued Identity Protection PIN with their other identifying information
So what happens if or when you become victim of tax identity theft
If you know for certain that your identity has been compromised the IRS has form for that
But if you ve already lost your tax refund to an identity thief their reporting mechanism may not be enough to resolve your existing case
If you know your information is in the hands of the bad guys make sure you cover your bases with the IRS as well as the credit reporting agencies the Social Security Administration and your creditors

While the IRS knows how many thieves it caught the Treasury Inspector General for Tax Administration suspects that an additional million fraudulent returns and billion in refunds slipped through IRS filters in

He also reported that the agency issued million in tax refunds that year to identity thieves based on the Social Security numbers that were used on multiple tax returns in after the criminals had submitted fake returns before legitimate taxpayers legally filed
If you are one of the unfortunate souls whose identity is compromised with the IRS you might personally have to do the legwork and it won be easy
Mallory is quite experienced in navigating federal bureaucracies yet still found herself being transferred multiple times and then held on hold by the understaffed IRS fraud department
She wasn able to get great deal of information and her accountant wasn allowed to help

Mallory only clarified the details of the theft when my colleagues at Identity Theft got involved and prepaid debit card which had been ordered by the thief to receive the refund showed up at the home of her parents

If you find your efforts stymied it worth making call to your insurance agent bank or credit union representative or the HR department at work to find out if they have program to help policy holders customers members or employees resolve identity theft issues
You may want to enroll now if it available and you may be pleasantly surprised to find that it free or can be had for nominal cost depending on your relationship with the institution
It can be game changer if you become victim

In cases where your return is blocked or refund has been issued to thieves or you are notified by the IRS that you significantly underreported your income because someone else had obtained employment using your SSN you ll have to have police report to start the process of proving to the IRS that you are who you say you are and you ve been victimized
Even then with the backlogs you ll still spend plenty of time on the phone and with paperwork trying to work out resolution to your case

When it comes to making money decisions doubt and self doubt are inevitable
After all unlike many choices that are subject to whimsy and fate financial decisions can be judged by their direct impact on your well being now and in the future
Or to put it simply It your money
Presumably you worked hard to accumulate it disciplined yourself to save it and now you want advice you can trust about how to manage it
Many of the questions posted on my blog at www TerrySavage com revolve around the issue of trust
Of course people who trust their own financial decision rarely post questions
Or maybe they just want second opinion
But many of the questions posted ask me to second guess advice or sales pitch from financial professional
My comments must be general because to give specific personal finance advice requires that an advisor know far more about an individual personal situation than could possibly be posted on blog
At most can point you in the right direction direction that presume will be the least biased by greed and the most supported by experience and integrity
So what should you know before you take financial advice or direction from an individual or company
What should you ask
What should you expect
How should you double check
In short whom should you trust

Finding Trusted Advisors Let me start by saying that there are bad people in every profession and it is never wise to assume that title degree an air of superiority or the appearance of financial success will guarantee you are dealing with an honest person
In fact the trappings of success lavish offices public profiles expensive entertainment and lifestyle are far too often the hallmark of fraudster running scam
But that just why scams continue because people are blindly attracted to success even when it seems unlikely in any rational form
Remember Madoff didn advertise
He got his next victims through word of mouth from people who bragged that he made them money in both up markets and down
How silly in hindsight and even at the time
So simply checking references from other clients is important but clearly it isn the entire answer
When it comes to financial professionals there are several websites that you might use to do background search
The most comprehensive database on both brokers and investment advisors is maintained at www FINRA org the industry self regulatory organization
The broker check feature gives backgrounds on all current and former brokers brokerage firms investment advisor firms and advisors
Recently it was revealed however that even the FINRA database does not give full background check of bankruptcies and other civil litigation
So you might also want to check your state database of registered brokers and advisors
Just because you are talking with someone who is employed by big name well known firm doesn mean you should be complacent
There are plenty of disciplinary actions taken against employees of major league firms
Also you can do search at www CFPBoard org and at www FeeOnly org for financial planners who have been certified after passing series of exams and pledging their duty to their clients
And speaking of names don be overly complacent because of the name on the front door
For example you might walk into bank and presume that anything you invest in will be safe and insured
Think again
You could be talking to representative from the investment company within the bank
The products they offer may have enticingly higher yields but no FDIC guarantee
Motivation Matters One of the best ways to figure out who on your side is to understand the motivation and the regulation behind their activities

For example despite great attempt on the part of the investment advisory industry to change things if you re dealing with broker or registered representative or investment consultant at brokerage firm these individuals are not required to put your best interest ahead of their own
Only registered investment advisor must adhere to fiduciary standard that requires the client interest to come first and requires the advisor to fully disclose any conflicts of interest
Brokers are only required to present suitable investments
Always ask the salesperson how he or she is being compensated
Is it an initial commission that comes out of your investment dollars
Are there surrender charges if you want to get out of the investment
Those charges help offset the broker commission
Are there additional annual management charges levied on your account
There are plenty of financial advisors who only charge fees and others who combine fees and commissions
But if the salesperson is getting paid only if you make purchase you re wise to think twice about his or her motivation
On the other hand good advice is always worth paying for
But how will you know the advice is good if you don ask the right questions about risk reward and costs
Trust Your Instincts And that brings me back to where started with the question of whom you should trust
First trust your own instincts
If something seems not quite right don be pressured into making decision
Get second opinion preferably from someone who isn just trying to sell you an alternative product
There never an investment opportunity that is so rare and so pressing that you can postpone decision while you do some research
As they say there always another train coming along
In the meantime while you try to decide what to do you can just leave your money in an insured money market deposit account earning little or no interest
You won lose money by being careful while you make an educated decision
Better safe than sorry
And that The Savage Truth
